description:
Perfect table for 2 or group hangouts with friends or colleagues. Really long selection of wines and great cheese pairings. Atmosphere gets a little noisy to where you feel comfortable being a little loud but not too crowded or loud to where you can hear your date.   

Staff was really nice as well.
author: David I.

description:
Cute wine bar with a bocce ball court outside. It really lives up to its name as it is sort of hidden in an alley way. The wine was good and pricing as expected for San Francisco. I will say the service here was particularly great. A group of four of us walked in at 5:30 on a Wednesday evening. There were no open tables, but the waitress let us sit at a table that was reserved until the group showed up at 6:00. After that, she led us to a table that she has saved for us in the meantime. 

You have to reserve the bocce ball court and I believe there is a $100 minimum which shouldn't be an issue if you have enough people.
author: Taylor F.

description:
Hmmmm. I wish I could give this place a better rating. It really had so much promise. I will say the ambience by itself deserves five stars. The service was pretty good too, but the wine and food were just okay and being that this is a wine venue, I just can't bring myself to give it four stars. 

I do like that it lives up to its name in the sense that it is hidden down a dark alley so you feel a certain joy in finding it, like a secret cave. 

We ordered a "comparison" flight which consists of 2  3 oz pours. We ordered the two Syrah/shiraz reds, one from Australia and one from the states. The Australian one was alright, but the American one was barely drinkable.

I also ordered the wild mushroom flatbread which was just meh. 

Also to note, they have a bocce ball set up on their side patio which I thought looked fun. 

Overall, though, probably not a return venue for me next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Katie W.

description:
As a lover of bocce ball and good wine, this place definitely hits the spot! My company does a summer event here every year and this year I was put in charge of managing the details for a bocce happy hour event. Hidden Vine made everything incredibly easy for me from picking the date, to choosing the menu, as well as just having everything set up and ready for us the day of!

We reserved the bocce court for a three-hour chunk and had some wonderful team bonding fun together. There's a cute little chalk board to notate which team is superior and seats everywhere for those looking to relax when it's not their turn. 

The food itself was wonderful! Everything we ordered we absolutely loved. The wine itself was amazing as well -- we went with whites, reds, and rose just to ensure everyone had something that fit their palette. The total came out to be rather costly but fair for everything we had ordered and for the awesome venue.

I can't wait for my next company event with Hidden Vine! Thanks Heather for helping coordinate and for making the event run as seamlessly as possible. You and the Hidden Vine team are amazing!
author: Christine W.

description:
I arrived in SFO about 6 hours before my wife and I was hangry so, after checking into the hotel, I found the Hidden Vine.  I knew that my wife wouldn't be flying in until after 1am and, by the time she got from the airport to downtown, it would likely be 2.  Kitchens long closed, last call called.    

And the lady likes bubbly....

So, I hit up Hidden Vine and grabbed a bottle of French champagne and a couple of flat breads take back to the room and store in our mini-fridge while awaiting her arrival.  Remarkably, after selecting my bottle "to-go", I was informed that it was 30% off since I wouldn't be drinking it in the restaurant.    Fantastic!   The flatbreads were pricey and since they immediately got put in the fridge, I can only say that they weren't half bad when they got reheated 3 hours later.   

The bartender was attentive and fun, the place was alive and hopping, and the glass of pinot I had while waiting on the flatbreads was delicious.   While I wasn't paying much attention to the crowd, it definitely struck me as upscale.  

By the time my love got in, Hidden Vine was closed, so boy did I score major points by surprising her with that bottle of France' finest and some tasty treats ;) 

I look forward to checking the place out again, hopefully together, next time SF is the destination....
author: Scott M.

description:
Very cute, hidden gem in San Francisco. My boyfriend surprised me and brought me here for some wine. I like the selection of wines. I got a GSM blend from Spain and my boyfriend got the Zinfandel. We were able to taste the wines before we ordered, which was great.

Will definitely return for round two! :)
author: Monica J.

description: Good environment and very good wine. We very much enjoyed  playing bocce ball while chatting and having wine.
author: Mahssa G.

description: My friend and I got wine flights ($17 each), two flat breads ($16 each), and shrimp sliders (came with 2 sliders) ($18). Everything was very good and service was friendly. However, I think the food is a little expensive for what it was. Two flights of wine and three orders of what I consider appetizers came to almost $100.
author: Annie L.

description:
Great place for amateurs to learn about wine and for connoisseurs to kick back and relax.

Pros:
+ Extensive list of Old and New World wines
+ Wine flights available, yes!!
+ Helpful and friendly servers
+ Great place for date night or just to hang after work

Cons:
- Hella packed on a Thursday night
- Parking could be an issue

Pro Tip:
+ Seats are not reserved, gotta snag them quick or get here early to avoid waiting
+ Wine flights are perfect for beginners or people who want to try different wines
+ Food menu available (did not eat here though)

I'm no wine connoisseur but this place is definitely a great spot to try out a variety of wines. I came with someone who knew quite a lot about wine and they taught me how to properly drink it. Made for a fun experience. We did a flight of white and a flight of reds.

Will be back to try out more flights!
author: Fanny W.

description:
After having dinner / happy hour nearby, I wanted one more drink. I did a quick Yelp search and Hidden Vine came up. I wanted to keep it tame and wine sounded good, so Peter L and I stopped by on Wednesday, March 1st around 7:45pm. There were a few tables open, so we grabbed a two top along the wall.

Flights: 3 x 2oz servings of wines
*Big and Bold: Shiraz, Tempranillo, Syrah Blend ($14)
*Southern Hemisphere: Uruguay, Brazil, Chile ($14)

We decided to try both red wine flights. I like big, bold wines, so I drank most of that one. I can't really recall which one I liked the best, but we did a side by side comparison. I think I liked my first pour and Peter's second pour. (Or it could have been vice versa.) For the last pour, I can't remember which one was better.  Maybe my palate was blown by then? Either way, I did enjoy the flights and it was a great way to sample six different wines.

I adored the laid back vibe of this wine bar. It's kind of hidden away in an alley, so it wasn't too busy. Or maybe because it was a Wednesday night? They have various tables scattered in the center with comfy couches and chairs as well as a small bar in the back. I could see myself enjoying some wine and having a good conversation with a friend or two. They also have a what I think is a small bocce ball set up to the left of the space.

Nice bar to enjoy some wine while catching up with a friend. I can see myself coming back to enjoying the Hidden Vine's cozy atmosphere.
author: Elena N.

description: Really enjoyed this place, the ambiance. A great place to relax and chill. Tried the champagne flight, and absolutely loved it. I also tried some of the red flight cab sav Southern Hemisphere - australia which was good as well. The vintage books added a nice touch. Would def come back.
author: Linda H.

description: Great date spot! Just a neat place. Good wine with good service!
author: Raquel M.

description:
This place is very charming and laid back wine bar located in a little alley off of Sansome. The seating is a free for all and the waiter was very helpful in helping my friends and I find a spot that fit all of us. They have a mixture of couches and bar stools, the lights were at a good level of dim and the music wasn't too loud to the point where you struggle to hear conversations. I would definitely come back for the ambiance!

I tried a white wine pairing and it was very interesting:
+ CLEAN AND CRISP: The first wine in this pairing fit the description spot on. It was very light but had a sharp crispness. The second one had an oaky finish.

My friends ordered the flatbread and it took a bit long to arrive and was pretty small for the price. I would probably just come back here for the chill, non-pretentious vibes and a good glass of wine.
author: Angela P.

description:
Definitely a charming wine bar on the edge of North Beach and Financial District. The wine list is divided into old world and new world wines and they have a good selection. They also have pretty yummy red and white wine flights. I'd suggest those if you aren't 100% sure on a wine. 

The service here can be pretty slow at times during peak hours and it can be hard to find a table (or couch, or huge comfy chairs depending on what's open) but the staff is very friendly and will make excellent recommendations. 

The food is okay. The first time I came I had the burrata crostini and the Italian sausage flatbread. Nothing to write home about as the wine is the star of the show here. Last night, four of us (2 getting got the charcuterie) plus drinks it was $158 total with tip. Will come back here again but it's not my absolute favorite wine bar in the city.
author: Kat L.

description:
Cozy wine bar, perfect for an evening with friends or a first date, though perhaps a bit on the pricey side for what it is. The sliders are actually quite good, but I recommend the flat-breads which pair better with wine and can actually be shared. 

The reason that the Hidden Vine does not get five stars is all about the by the glass wine selection. There are a lot of wines served that would generously earn an 86. It's unfortunate-- there are actually plenty of wines they could serve at these price points that are actually worth tasting. I recommend doing a bit of research before you go, since some of their foreign stuff is very third rate. 

Still, the ambiance is great and there are a few good wines on the menu, just expect to pay a premium for the experience.
author: David H.

description: We came here after work to celebrate my coworker getting married. It took a while to get us seated since we had a large group of 10+ people. The atmosphere and environment is really chill. Definitely take your friends or coworkers here if you want to relax and talk. My favorite wine here was the Pinot.
author: Michael L.

description: Good jam, fun flights, satisfying bites, and bocce ball.  This cool cozy place is off the beaten path but it still gets busy.  This is one of my favorite pit stops on my way home after work.  Must drink here.  Grab a seat next to the fireplace and sip. sip. sip.
author: Amy J.

description: This hidden gem is super cute, comfy, and welcoming once inside. There is a great variety of wines. We had 2 flights of red imports which were amazing. The atmosphere is great for dates and meeting up with friends. I would totally recommend this place and I would definitely go back.
author: Marcia C.

description:
Great service, loved the wine. 
I had no plans this Saturday so decide to grab a glass of wine after I did some shopping downtown and The Hidden Wine came to mind. Great wine selection. I had this wine from Lebanon that just hit the spot. 

I'll definitely come back.
author: Moni K.

description: Amazing wine flights! Only thing was I wish they were a little more attentive. Asked for napkins and never got it so my date took out his business card to spit his gum in. It was a little funny because when he took out his business card, I was thinking is this guy seriously going to give me his business card. Lol... overall it was good.
author: Judy T.

description: I came here with a friend for the first time last night, and absolutely fell in love with this spot. Great ambiance, excellent service, and delicious wine flights. I didn't have the chance to play, but it's pretty neat that they have a bocce court in the back as well. We split one of the flatbreads, and it was heavenly. I'll be back very soon :)
author: Amelia Q.

description: Went after dinner with my plus one. It was the end of the evening so we were starting feel a bit sluggish but were looking forward to good glass of wine. The wine we got was fantastic. I got a flight of Greek wines and she got the Califoirnia white flight. The service was incredibly slow which was surprising considering the bar was not that busy. The first thing we ordered upon arrival was water and it took 3 more asks and another server to get us hydrated. On top of our sluggishness the slow service pushed us deeper into fatigue. Might try again another night but with the plethora of wine bars in the city it will be sometime before they get a second shot.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Lovely ambience. Our waitress was absolutely delightful. I think she was from Romania. She was super helpful and patient with our wine selection. She steered us towards her favorite Zin and it was right on the mark! We sat on one of the comfortable leather couches and took our time and enjoyed the fabulous wine. It is a great place for a business meeting as it was not too loud. This place is good for young professionals wanting a quiet evening or for an older local crowd. It's also probably a great place for a first bumble date - classy and quiet enough to actually have a conversation.
author: E T.

description: Great place to grab a glass or two after work.  I know I'm not the only one to share that idea as it was wall to wall people when I stopped by.  Decor is inviting and the wine list has some really intriguing selections.  Staff works hard, but based on what I observed, they could use a few more of them to help during the rush; service was very slow.  If you can grab a couch, consider yourself lucky; those are the prime (and most comfortable) seats in the entire place.  My advice?  Get to Hidden Vine early, grab a couch, order a glass (or five) of wine and enjoy the people watching and relaxed environment.
author: Jeff H.

description:
Hidden Vine is a hidden gem amidst the concrete San Francisco jungle. A secret hideaway with exposed brick walls,  romantic vibe, and a great wine selection. Finding a place in SF city where I can unwind after work with good wine and food is harder than it should be. This place offers an exceptional list of rotating wines (red, white, and bubbles), and I've yet to be let down. Atmosphere is casual intimate, cozy enough for conversation and welcoming to groups. I was here with my coworkers after a long week and loved the vibe. 

Their food is delicious the flat breads and sliders are good bar bites. The Marcona almonds and Thyme and citrus marinated olives were addicting. Service is present and friendly without being obtrusive, and they have an outdoor bocce ball court you have the book the bocce ball online in advance. 

Overall, I highly recommend checking out the Hidden Vine. Wonderful place for a date and for groups. Five stars!
author: Maria M.

description: Very cozy and charming wine bar with a decent selection of wines (won't say it's the most extensive but good enough for a casual night out with friends). My only gripe is that it closes a bit too early... closes at midnight.
author: Olivia P.

description:
I loved the atmosphere! One side is brick wall, the other features a tapestry and a fireplace. The area has a bar, several couches, armchairs and bar tables. You can sit in front of the fireplace or you can chat up the bartender! 

The wine menu is impressive, I would definitely recommend the flights. There are many wines that you would not find at your local Total Wine or BevMo. Very fair pricing and the server really knows what he is talking about. 

I did not have a chance to try anything from the food menu -- but I will next time! (The have some delicious sounding sliders)
author: Raisa D.

description: This was a really cool secret wine bar I had been wanting to try for awhile. They have an outdoor bocce court and it's conveniently located in the financial district. There is no sign to enter, just a big wooden door. I am sad I didn't find this gem sooner! I work 2 blocks away so will definitely be back. They have a decent food menu for snacks, then options for bottles, glasses or unique flights.
author: Carol Ann V.

description:
Like how this does feel tucked away -- came on a Saturday evening for a light dinner with some friends and was able to get a table for 4. 

Bocce court was unfortunately occupied for the hour we were there. Service was friendly, though a little slow to get some items.

Food review:
- Peach + beets salad: NOMS, highly recommended. 
- Burrata crostini with strawberries: super tasty, but the bread was a little too in-between hard and chewy. still, would recommend
- Ratatouille flatbread: tasted like a home-cooking pizza bready crust, but really good and fresh
- Chicken sliders: would not recommend, very bland chicken and 'served with vegetables' really means just a few pickled veggies on the side

Overall, would come back - dark ambiance and not too loud, not slammed with people. Great place for some light bites.
author: Kristie C.

description:
This was an awesome find! We wanted a loungey area to go to after our nice dinner at Boulevard. The Hidden Vine also boasted a bocce court which was something very different to do.  We made reservations for the bocce court and when we got there, we could have used it but it was FREEZING so we passed on it and sat inside.

Our server, Enrique, was so fun. And dreamy. We sat in the "medieval" room which had a very 13th century wall hanging behind the table.  The wine list is nice and they had proseccos, champagne and whites/reds.  I had a glass of malbec and champagne.  We all enjoyed our drinks and had fun with Enrique and Cassidy. 

 It was a great way to cap the night off. The bill comes in these old wine related books so you can leave messages in them as well.
author: Milee S.

description: If you want to enjoy a glass of wine and you're in the downtown area, drop in. Lovely setting!
author: Kitty W.

description: Came here for a post engagement party and was pleasantly surprised. Fantastic atmosphere, friendly staff, good food and a magical evening. It's the perfect location to people watch and see the who's who of San Francisco night life.
author: Mikeal B.

description: We stumbled across this wonderful gem on a hot Saturday in Summer. Enrique was super friendly and knowledgeable!! I mentioned I needed help finding a wine I would like. After a short conversation, he came back with his recommendation and he nailed it! Frogs Leap Zin is now on my shopping list! The service along with the unique and relaxing atmosphere made for a great time! We will be back!
author: Jeni K.

description: Incredible service! We came here for our anniversary and they gave us complimentary local truffles. So thoughtful. The wine selection is diverse, unique, and wonderful! Love the intimate low-light atmosphere. Many 2-person tables and then some lounge couch/chair areas and 4-person tables. Everyone sticks to their own party, so not a typical social bar scene. Love this place, highly recommend!
author: Ashley C.

description: My co-worker and I wanted to try a new spot for drinks after work and came across this place. So happy that we did!!! Loved it. Food was good, wine was great and the service was awesome!! I loved our server. He was funny and on top of it! It was really packed when we arrived and he told us about a table that about to leave so we hung out for 2 minutes and then sat right down. We ordered a good amount of snacks so he actually moved us to a bigger table that opened up. Didn't have to do that, but it made the experience even better! My only con with this spot is it's pretty pricy. $8 for a small little piece of Brie and $8 for like 4 or 5 small slices of meat.... but it was delish! And we will for sure be back!!
author: Kimberly W.

description:
What a great wine bar! It's got a great clubby atmosphere without feeling stuffy.  The layout is such that there is always room to find a spot for you and your friends that feels private.

The particular upside of this place, however, is the spectacular by the wine selection. Wine nerds rejoice!  The flights are inventive and well-priced, and whether you want a glass of an obscure varietal from a lesser known region or a more of a classic choice, the list has lots of options. And the servers are helpful and down to earth to help you pick something if you find the choice overwhelming.

I am excited to visit again!
author: Jessica L.

description: Flew in from LA for the weekend to visit a friend, and checked out this place while I waited for her to get off from work. What a cool spot for some great wine, and the mushroom flatbread was so delicious - seriously mouthwatering. I think I'll make it tradition now to stop at this place first every time I come into the city.
author: Mo M.

description: Probably the worst bar in SFO, take forever to give you the menu. And just never show up to actually take the order. Worst place to spend your time.
author: Edu P.

description:
This is such as cute wine bar. The dark decor feels warm and reminds me of the comfort of a ski lodge. I met up with my date here, who had a head start on drinks. I'm always drawn to Gruner Veltliner and the one they had here was good. 

When it came time to get our next glass, we asked the server for recommendations and he was honest and helpful.

The food here is very good! I loved the Bolsa (with Soppressata and Manchego) although they looked a little smaller in person than I had imagined after looking at photos.

The bocce ball area looks fun (when it's warm). This is a great place for an intimate date or a get together with friends.
author: Yi Z.

description: This is one of my favorite after work spots for a book and a flight or to meet a friend.  I love getting the cozy chairs by the fireplace and work close enough that it's often possible!  Even sitting at the bar is lovely - the bartenders and wait staff are friendly and helpful and the wine options varied and tasty.
author: Kim C.

description:
This is a really cute wine bar. It's very spacious, but yet manages to feel cozy.

I came here on a Friday night with a friend, and there was enough seating still available. The servers were very nice and extremely knowledgeable. They helped us pick out a wine flight each, which we both liked, and was very reasonably priced.

They also have a bocce ball area, and serve some food, making this a good spot for a date or to catch up with a friend.
author: Tanay J.

description: A wide selection of wines. I especially liked the choice of Greek wines. A great bar with a very noticeable, very good selection of snacks to accompany drinks. Be careful, it is crowded.
author: Priscilla M.

description:
Beautifully crafted wine bar that has multiple options for intimate seat settings. The waiters were very accommodating to be sure that my friends and I were comfortable with the venue. The light was too bright for a friend so they had turned down the lights. 

Wide selection of wines from Italy, Croatia, and other parts of Europe to many vineyards including Napa Valley. 

Absolutely love the setting of this bar and would love to come back.
author: Trang L.

description:
So. Wine selection is great and great appetizErs.  He flatbread is good as well as the baruta and cheese plates. The sliders were delicious but overpriced. $24 for 3 tiny sliders. The shrimp slider was delicious. 

We initially had a bar tender at our T ale that came to our table and was attending us but besides the external appearance was very BLaH and not once smiled.  But then Tim became our waiter and he was beyond wonderful. For my fries a bday he gave us all shots of champagne that were just what we needed on the house and brought some berry truffles that were beyond spectacular. 

They have. Bocce court in the patio which is really nice and available after 5pm.   It's so good.
author: David C.

description:
I used to come here frequently, and after my most recent experience, I WILL NEVER GO HERE AGAIN. I traveled over a half hour with my 3-month-old baby to stop by my friend's moving away party during happy hour time. As soon as I said hi, our waitress told me I had to leave because I had my baby with me (who was not making a peep). I politely asked if I could at least spend a couple of minutes saying hi. I was told "yes," but a few minutes later, the manager literally escorted me out of the bar, like someone who had just caused a fight.

I HAVE GONE TO MANY ESTABLISHMENTS IN SF WITH MY BABY AND HAVE NEVER HAD A PROBLEM. And even if having my baby with me for a few minutes was a real legal problem for them (which apparently it's not for any other place), they could have handled the situation with some class. Unfortunately, they did not.
author: Amanda B.

description: Decided to stop by on a whim with a friend, as neither of us had ever been. We were aware that the seating was first come first served, however when we walked in there happened to be a server by the door and kindly asked if she happened to know a spot for two. She walked away and never came back. We stood around sheepishly for a few moments, scoped the room, and while we could have probably wrangled up two seats, the whole interaction made us feel so unwelcome that we decided to walk to a different bar.
author: Wendy A.

description:
Cute little wine bar with a bocceball court tucked away in a tiny alley. I typically head next door to Cafe Prague but The Hidden Vine is always a nice option with friends who prefer to lounge over a bottle or two. 

It understandably fills up pretty quickly after work given its FiDi location but if you get here right after work, you should be able to score a seat. Service is decent but they do get slammed. Decent selection of wines to select from. The Hidden Vine is probably better for intimate gatherings. It gets a little awkward in a larger group since the space isn't configured for that. A slim food menu accompanies the wines. 

if you're looking for an intimate spot for happy hour in the FiDi, definitely consider The Hidden Vine especially if you're looking for some vino.
author: Jon L.

description:
Came for a company event and loved it! We got the mini pizzas, cheese & meat platters, and tried 3 bottles of wine. 

Honestly, I think I was more interested in the food than the wine haha. The mushroom pizza was absolutely delicious! But we later on decided to order more wine when a waiter came up to our group and told us our cheese was comped for some anniversary they were having (so nice!). 

A great place to come after work and hang out and relax!
author: Carrie L.

description: Came here with a friend who was curious to visit her first wine bar, and she was in love with the place the moment she walked in. The table we sat had hidden notes someone stashed into the brick wall. It was a cool lounge atmosphere with low lights. We happened to find the only open table where a server named Dace welcomed us. We were then asked by another waitress who's name we didn't get, which we should have because she was very rude. We ordered our first two glasses of wine which took a while, but Dace was very kind and offered the two glasses to us. For the food the waitress came the first time and we were not ready, she seemed a bit irate. When we did make our food order everything was fine, my female friend received her cheese plate just fine, but a very long time passed, we were done with the cheese plate, and we finally asked Dace about the crab cakes we ordered. He rushed to find the waitress who took our order, and she seemed to brush him off a bit, some time late the crab cakes came out. I would give this place 3 stars because of the waitress alone, but Dace made our experience one that made us want to come back again. So our 5 stars goes out to Dace for being awesome, the place was awesome, the flights of wine were great, so we'll be back, but we'll probably have to ask for a different waitress next time.
author: wayz W.

description:
Great staff and selection of wines.
I like the ambience, though can get quite loud...
Call ahead to reserve seats for a large crowd.
Didn't like the flatbread pizza... overpriced.
Flights were not as good... prefer one full glass
author: Sunny S.

description: I mean it's pricy but the wine selection is great and if you are unsure about which wine to choose they have flights and also serve you a small portion to taste. Be warned however that food here is pricy and small. I did love my flatbread with chicken and artichoke hearts though. That's worth choosing if you are hungry it was on the bigger side. Their cheese plates are so tiny mine had one cheese on it
author: M. U.

description: Hidden gem that my co-workers only recently introduced me to, it has ample seating for such a small space, from cozy couches to the standard bar stools. I enjoyed the flatbreads, and the Italian flight. Extra points for keeping my laptop safe after I left it behind -- oops!
author: Kim S.

description:
This place is a hidden (haha) gem - definitely my favorite wine bar in SF and probably ever. The aesthetic is very rustic chic/romantic with a fireplace, small tables and tons of squashy arm chairs. 

They have a superb selection of wine that changes monthly(?) and flights based on different regions and flavor palates. I wouldn't come here for the food, but they do have a decent charcuterie board and sliders. 

This is definitely my go-to spot to bring people when I can't think of anything so basically all the time. Overall five stars for wine, ambiance and service.
author: Rebecca W.

description:
Loved This Place!

+ server was polite and attentive
+ wine flights were great
+ get all the meats and all the cheeses! yum
+ ambiance was great
+ decently sized happy hour crowd
+ games on the patio
author: Laura L.

description: Great wine bar convenient for financial district happy hour. There's a good wine selection and some delicious small plates as well. This spot also has a bocce court that you can reserve in advance online. It can get crowded and somewhat difficult to find a table, but the atmosphere is great and have had several memorable long happy hours here.
author: Emily F.

description:
I came here for an event with my coworkers and it's so cute! We rented the outdoor bocce court and ordered some wine and food. It was a great team bonding activity.

For wine, we got the Pinot Noir which was very smooth. We also tried most things on the menu. The charcuterie board was delicious with a really good truffle cheese and a brie. We also tried all the flatbreads, my favorite was the sausage. We did the Rainbow Chard and White Bean burger with no bun which was as one would have guessed, good enough but not like a real hamburger haha. The Burrata, balsamic-black pepper strawberries, and Speck on toasted Acme Crostini was really good, probably my favorite. I love cheese though so I would have liked a little more buratta on each piece.

Super fun place, I would definitely recommend it.
author: Jenna G.

description: I came here last week while in town for work with a new colleague.  It's really intimate so I would definitely recommend it for date night.  The wine was great, the pizza (or flatbread- this is not pizza by my Chicago standards) was great just more snack-able than a meal.  Service was great, ambiance great- I'll come back when I'm in town next.
author: Rachel S.

description: I'm not a big wine bar guy, but we had a blast here on Friday evening.  Cassidy (our waiter) really stood out, from the moment we entered.  Given I don't know much about wine, I asked him a few questions and he was totally gracious and patient - very unlike the hipsters that try to make you feel like you don't fit in elsewhere. In fact, he dropped half a glass of really nice wine in front of us saying that he opened the wrong bottle for someone else, and wanted us to enjoy ourselves.  Just one example of the service we experienced.  I'd go back in a heartbeat.
author: Michael D.

description: Loved the wines (quality), food (delicious), service (pleasant and amicable), contingent (caliber), and ambiance (personal and non-pretentious) . A+. Would recommend for quality time spending with anyone special.
author: Nara B.

description: I love this place. Wines and food always on point. The staff is friendly, caring and knowledgeable. Ambiance is beautiful for a small group, date or even a larger party and of course bocce ball!! Ever since I found this place I visit as often as I can.
author: Kristan B.

description:
What an unexpected, hole in the wall (however, spacious on the inside) wine venue!  

The interior of this hidden gem that is located in an alley, is marvelously cozy and pleasant.  There are tables and a fireplace where you can chit chatter around!  The layout is simply lovely.

There is surprisingly a bocce ball in the backyard if you are up for play!

Servers come around to take orders and if not, the open bar is just in the same room  They have a huge side dining room that is for a private event.  

They have a wide variety of refined wine.  I love the French wine, which was smooth and clean tasting to the palate. 

From the ambiance, entertainment of the bocce ball and to the wine selections, it was surely an enjoyable time here!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Great ambience and relatively quieter. Bartenders are really friendly and there is a feel of sophistication that the ambience brings.
author: Thulasi N.

description:
This is a very nice wine bar. It's kinda hidden, hence the name of the place. It's dark and intimate. There are plush couches and leather seats. And I think I saw a pew. 

It was my first time here, so I wasn't sure what wine to order. They have a lot to choose from. The server was very nice and helpful. I ended up getting the red wine flight. It was very good. The service here was great. I was impress to see they brought the bill in an old book. 

I'm definitely coming back to this place when I want to chill and get some good vino.
author: Edie G.

description:
Came for the first time for happy hour with a group, and thoroughly enjoyed the food and wine selection. We had a 5:30 reservation, which definitely seemed necessary, because it got pretty crowded.

Highlights: the pickled vegetables, the manchego puff pastry, the prosciutto, and the vegetarian flatbread.

Slightly weird: they kept changing how bright the lights were, which was odd and distracting, and poured the first bottle of wine without offering a taste to the person who selected it.

Overall, though, the ambience was very comfortable, and the food was great!
author: Liz F.

description: I love the Hidden Vine. I have been there twice. The first time I had amazing service and a beautiful glass of white wine that one of the servers helped me to select. The second time, my husband and I were passed by servers for 20 minutes without a mere glance. It was bizarre and irritating, but didn't undo my positive first experience. The wine list is selective and varied. We also shared a flatbread that was unexpectedly delicious. In sum: Amazing wine, variable service, but the wine might somewhat compensate for the staff's hospitality.
author: Lawren B.

description:
Julie Z and I tried out the Hidden Vine on our quest to find the best happy hour in San Francisco and we were so glad we did! The Hidden Vine touts itself as more of a a ine bar and has a nice selection of tasting flights as well as wine by the glass. 

ATMOSPHERE:  At first look, it is a nice, classy place with dim romantic mood lighting. Although we came in on a Wednesday night though, it was packed, clearly showing how popular it was. 

BAD: While I really liked the look and feel of the place, the space was way too cramped. For some reason, people would just randomly stand around in between tables chatting. Sometimes they would pack so closely to our table, their backs (or butts) kept brushing up against our wine glasses, threatening to tip them over. So that was definitely not one of my favorite parts.

SERVICE: We had really amazing waiters who were very attentive despite the busy night. Our food and wine came instantly and they were so accommodating in trying to help us find wines suited to our palate when we both realized we didn't like most of the wines in the tasting flight. Lastly, our server was incredibly sweet - after realizing we had been squashed in a corner by the patrons milling around, he gave us a glass of complimentary wine to make up for the experience. So definitely lots of brownie points for service!

FOOD: UM, INCREDIBLE. We ordered the prosciutto flat bread which was crispy and delicious. And the cheese, gah, to die for. We also had the burrata which honestly was the highlight of my meal, and I don't even like burrata. The cheese was so creamy, light and delicious, and paired perfectly with the prosciutto, pear and crispy bread. A DEFINITE must order!! Will 100% come back just for the burrata.

WINE: I love wine but didn't love any of my selections for the night, and apparently neither did Julie Z who ordered a tasting flight of cabs and complained they tasted like cheap $2 wine. Unfortunately, I felt the same about my flight of Oregon wines which all had a strong "plasticky" smell and taste. The only saving grace of the night was my glass of Californian chardonnay which was delicious but not mindblowing. Disappoint.

All in all, the Hidden Vine is a nice place to hang out while you're in the city. It definitely wasn't one of my favorite places because of the crowdedness, the noise level and the disappointing wines, but man, that burrata. I would cross oceans to have it again.
author: Sarah T.

description:
What I had: wine flight, beef and pork sliders
Visit date: November 8, 2014
First time? Yes.

Truly hidden. Nice, classy but casual place to have a drink and chat with you friends, or to watch awkward dates happen. The seats are plenty and comfortable, the staff are friendly and helpful when it comes to choosing beverages, and the ambience is romantic and cozy like a winter's cabin complete with "fire"place. To be honest, I'm not a wine person but when you're in a wine bar you have wine! So, since I couldn't commit to a whole glass I chose a flight; this is always a good choice for me. What I was really there for were the sliders (well, that and my friend's birthday ;). We tried the pulled pork and beef sliders (they had run out of the shrimp). Sliders come two to an order. The pulled pork was tender and juicy, and packed much more flavor than the beef. I also enjoyed the side of pickled vegetables that came with the order.
author: Erin G.

description: Randomly decided to come here around 8pm on a Thursday night and wasn't really sure what to expect. Walked in with my friend and really liked the dark and cozy atmosphere. I was a little intimidated at first since I'm not a professional wine drinker and everyone there looked like they knew what they were doing. I was soon put at ease when our server seated us and patiently walked us through the large menu of wines. We ended up getting two flights, one red and one white, each about $20, a little pricey but worth the experience! I was super satisfied with the wine and the service and will definitely be back!
author: Nancy C.

description: Really large wine list without being overwhelming. Tons of options for each type of wine, price ($10 and up) and taste. The atmosphere is really nice with low lighting and lots of different types of seating from couches, bar, inside and outside seating.
author: Juliana P.

description:
This place, like the name, is hidden and tucked in a small alleyway.  I even walked past it because it's so small.  But look out for the sign above the door to know when you've reached the place.  I came here on a team outing for work.  To reserve a small standing room area and the bocce ball area (YES BOCCE BALL!!) you'll have to call ahead of time and I believe theres a minimum food and drink charge of $100.  That won't be hard however because the food is more on the pricey side for hors d'oeuvre.  

This wine bar is so cozy and intimate.  It has a fireplace and some comfy sitting areas including couches.  And the interior is dark and quiet.  We came on a Monday night so maybe it would be more lively on a Friday.  

The food was amazing! Lamb burger sliders, mushroom flatbread pizza, garlic puff pastry bundles, prosciutto and duck flatbread (if I remember correctly).  All amazing and the woman who served our group (sadly don't remember her name) was so friendly and accomodating.  She explained the wine selection at least ten times to us because we came in staggers in groups.  

And don't worry I haven't forgotten to include the bocce ball area!  It's outside and pretty narrow.  Theres's some benches on the side for spectators to sit and watch.  Really nice on a good SF night when the weather isn't too cold.  But it was entertaining to play and watch others play while we had appetizers and sipped on wine.
author: Michelle B.

description: Amazing ambiance. Stumbled upon this hidden gem after seeing a comedy show and have now found my new favorite wine bar.  Dark and moody and bocce ball outside! Love, love this place. Great wine selection and small plates as well.
author: Kim W.

description: Hosted a networking happy hour in their semi-private room near the front entrance and was very impressed by the space and, above all, the staff. They always had a smile on their face, were very responsive, and went above and beyond to meet our needs-- one of them even offered to print off signs with our logo on them when I expressed concern that our guests might not know where to go. Several guests raved about the food (we had ordered a mushroom flatbread, shrimp sliders, beef sliders, and a cheese/charcuterie board). Highly recommend for group events.
author: Jordana M.

description:
Nothing like rules and fees to totally kill your buzz. 
We threw a going away party for a co-worker friend at Hidden Vine. I called ahead and was told I'd need to guarantee a $500 drink minimum if we wanted a communal room. We skipped that and sent some folks early to secure a seat. When they got there they were informed of rule after rule! "No moving chairs" "No sitting at that table, it's taken" and on and on. When I arrived with cupcakes it was publicly decreed it'd cost $2 per cupcake for serving them. They entered the dozen in their system and watched us like a hawk for any cupcake eating! Our colleagues were afraid to eat because they felt bad the fees cost more than the cakes! They kept hounding us about what tab the drinks would go on. Oh yeah - their sliders were average, the wine expensive.
This place should be called "The Fine Print" or "The Hidden Rules"!
author: Brady K.

description:
UPDATE 9/21/15:  After a brief Yelp message exchange with the management, I realized two things:  1)They actually were very helpful and accommodating during our stay here based on their response as well as some other guest feedback I got since I posted this review.  I was a bit unfair and uninformed on how the night went.  2)They actually do care about all types of feedback and wrote back to me right away.  I mean I certainly didn't 1 star them but I appreciate their quick response.

Any business that can respond to my feedback after a less than ideal experience, certainly deserves another chance and the management team and staff here did more that what I initially thought that night.  Kudos to them and the uptick in rating will reflect that.
author: Ben H L.

description:
What's not to like about a place that has a bocce ball court? :) the wine selection is wonderful. I had the Italian featured flight which was on point! 3 wines to taste for approx $14! Several other flights available for those who like to go on a wine adventure. Beautifully designed space with exposed brick wall and cosy fire places as well as comfortable couches.
Definitely coming back. Some food on offer too.
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
Such a nice wine bar! When I go to SF I definitely want to come back here again.

They have such cute decor, and oh yes 3 wine flights of 2oz. :) My favorite!!! I personally like getting wine by the glass but this gives you a chance to try out different ones.
author: Diana H.

description:
A friend and I came here for Happy Hour on a Friday afternoon. Pretty nice place -- very cute, nice selection of wines and appetizer dishes. I just went with a simple Moscato ($9/glass) which was delicious. Service is fairly attentive here. As some other Yelpers have described, it does feel like you're in a rich friend's apartment or something -- chairs are super comfy and cozy, and they've got an outdoor bocce court! I'm not really a huge wine person -- I literally only drink Moscatos so my review is probably not going to give you much perspective on the actual place. My friend went with the Eastern European wine flight (only $15, pretty cheap) and enjoyed how interesting the flavors were. 

tldr; overall, nice atmosphere, very laid back and chill with a large variety of wine options to likely please any palette
author: Jasmine X.

description: Great ambiance. Good wine with reasonable prices. Perfect choice of music for a chill and relaxing evening.
author: Echo R.

description: Came here with a group to celebrate a birthday. Very comfortable area with couches and chairs. The pizza was solid. The stuffed croissant type food was awesome. Lots of drink options. Modern setting and good service.
author: J. Karim A.

description: Seriously love this place!  I have brought 2 big groups and they were so great at keeping the drinks and food flowing, plus they have an amazing wine list (anything you would every want!).  They serve mostly small plates, but it is perfect when you like a little of everything.  There was a  "DJ" (intimate place, don't get the wrong idea) who was playing all our favorite tunes from the past.  The ambiance is romantic but very relaxed.  We reserved the Bocce ball court and there were laughs, dancing and fabulousness all night long!  I have also been with smaller groups and just a couple of us and we are never disappointed... Whenever there was any mistakes, they are so on top of it and super kind and courteous. If I worked in the area, I am sure this would be my happy hour place.
author: Nikki B.

description: My husband and I found this spot in the hustle of the Financial District. We easily found a seat at the bar and had a great bartender that gave us some good food and wine recommendations. The wine selection was great- I settled for a decent Cab and my husband went with a beer. We ordered the Italian sausage flatbread, which was overrated in my opinion, but got the job done. Overall, the intimate setting and friendly staff really won us over.
author: Torie M.

description: All the products were fresh and the dishes had the warmth of home-made food. The chefs take great care in selecting the best quality ingredients. The restaurant also caters for all tastes by providing a large selection of the best wines of the region, which are pricy but worth sampling.
author: Allison G.

description: Absolutely hidden... lol. The service was top notch! Seriously! We were served by Cassidy and Karissa... both were fun, professional, and extremely knowledgeable.  They not only ran a tight ship but kept it engaging and interesting. The music was great and the wine was fantastic.
author: Jennifer W.

description: I liked this place! Great wine selection and some beers, too. The bocce ball court is a cool place to hang and play if you're into that. It's only one court and pretty small space, but there are some benches to sit and watch. I didn't have any of their food but it all looked kind of small and pricey.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Nice ambiance. Great place for a date or to catch up with friends. There's a bocce court, but you have to reserve it and it's uneven. 

The apps are pretty good too. 

Hard to get a seat sometimes after work.
author: Ana G.

description:
As always, a phenomenal experience. Tucked away on Merchant St, The Hidden Vine is the perfect venue for a post-work date or for a large get-together with friends. Recently, hosted a party for over 40+ guests and The HV was wonderfully accommodating on all fronts. Reserved the large entry area + the bocce court for the evening and despite it being a busy night, the staff was quick to replace glasses, bring bottles of wine, and serve great lil' bites of food (to include excellent vegetarian fare).

Special shout-out to Erin as she helped plan the menu, discussed ideal bottle selections, and other aspects of event planning. She was always readily available during the days prior to discuss any concerns.  Planning a large outing is akin to herding cats... can be stressful in ways that guests do not know! But Erin and her team made everything that much easier. 

From start to finish... a great time for all guests!  Will always keep The Hidden Vine at the top of my list.
author: Dan K.

description: Nice wine bar in an older looking brick building in a quiet alley like street.  Nice space inside with bare brick walls and various seating options. I was happy to see a variety of wines available by the glass at reasonable prices (for SF anyway). They have a number of ways to order flights of wine in interesting combinations. My wife and I sat at the bar and had excellent service. They also have food ( small bites mostly on the menu). We ordered the Bolsa with manchego and Soprasetta. It came as 5 puff pastry pieces stuffed with the cheese an Soprasetta. It was ok, but a bit too salty. Will come back for the wine.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Stopped in for a glass of wine, while in the area with a little time to kill.  There was a nice menu of wines available.  The waitress knew the menu well and was able to make suggestions based on the type of wine I like.  Her recommendation was just right.

It is a nice space and pretty full, but not too crowded.

I only had wine, so I cannot review the food.

There was also a room right by the entry that seemed to have an event going on, so may be a good place for a private party.

I would definitely return.
author: Susan K.

description: Really solid find. Big comfy chairs and warm atmosphere + knowledgable staff. Would like to see a bigger range of price points on wines (with options to skimp & options to stretch), but what we had on recommendation were well made and tasty. Will be back for sure!
author: Rich W.

description: Such a perfect and cozy spot for HH! Not too loud so you can converse with friends. A good selection of wines (old and new world) and tasty bites.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Cool place, with exposed brick wall and an outdoor patio.
Pretty good wine selection, servers were courteous and knowledgeable about their wine.
Also ordered some appetizers, duck prosciutto and Salametto Piccante, both were very good.
author: Mark B.

description: Came here two days in a row, while visiting out of town. This place is a hidden gem. Very attentive staff, who is interested to cater to your taste and provide you wine tasting options that expand your horizons. The charcuterie plate and small bites were delicious as well. Absolutely recommend it, and will be back here every time I am in the city.
author: T T.

description:
This is a seriously gorgeous bar with an amazing selection of old and new world wines of every variety. The cost per glass is 4 or 5 times more than what I normally spend per bottle on el cheapo wine from Trader Joe's, but even my somewhat insensitive palate could detect that there may be a valid reason for this, along with "night out in SF" markup. 

Service seemed lackadaisical. I asked for a taste of an expensive Pinot noir before committing to its price tag. It got poured and the bartender left the rest of the bottle out with it but then promptly disappeared somewhere. I DID love the wine but couldn't tell if I was now supposed to pour myself the rest of the bottle. Plus, what if I didn't like that wine and wanted to try something else? There were some other bartenders wandering in and out from behind the bar who paid no attention to me, and I finally spotted MY bartender socializing at a table in the room. She finally returned and I STILL had trouble getting her attention, but she completely apologized once I did -- "oh my God, I just completely ignored you, how terrible of me." The wine was so good and the atmosphere was so elegant and soothing and I was having a good time anyway, so it wasn't that big a deal -- but I do hope for more attentive service next time.
author: Sheri W.

description: Great spot for a nice glass of vino amongst a great energetic crowd in the financial area of downtown San Fran. It's hidden on a narrow street so make sure to keep your eyes peeled for the dimly lit entrance. Cool atmosphere and great place for drinks with colleagues, clients or that special someone!
author: andrew E.

description: Great space in the alley; spacious, warm and inviting. There's a Bocce court outside for those who play. Delicious wine varieties. Friendly staff. Minus one star for food price-menu items are quite pricey for what you receive (especially the cheeses). That being said, the food we ordered (crab sliders and sausage flatbread) was good.
author: Rise G.

description:
It probably makes sense to write a review for a wine bar when you actually know something about wine. I don't. I mean, I can distinguish red and white. But embarrassingly, I always need to ask the waiter to get me something "on the sweeter side". White please. Because Red makes me sleepy.

But even as a Dummy I love this place. Classic, chic, beautiful, soothing interior. And best of all: brick-exposed walls, dim light.

Food (tapas-style) is on the menu, so if you come hungry you'll be pleased. Busy nights are Thu-Sat, with the Financial District folks flocking the place. Separate room for groups is available.

Hiiden Vine, you got me. Another White, please.
author: Sebastian F.

description: Cannot say enough good things about this place! It's super convenient if you work in Fidi and the service is impeccable. If you're a wino, you need to check out this chic spot.
author: Mindy S.

description: A gem!  I loved the ambience and the servers. It was nice to just sit down and have quality time with friends and actually be able to hear each other.  I HIGHLY recommend this beautiful place.
author: Aladdin N.

description: Great wine right across the alleyway from my hotel.  Nice, dark and cozy.  You can get glasses or flights, and their blue cheese plate was perfect.  We were so comfortable on the couch, we took our shoes off!  Our server, Cassidy, was a plus, super nice guy, sat and talked to us for a while.  An easy stmble across the alley to our hotel was also a plus.
author: kathy a.

description:
amazing hidden gem. i was on my way back from the battery and decided to stop in for a drink while I was waiting for a friend. The vibe is super intimate and trendy, and the wine selection is pretty intimidating.

get the burrata. and this is a place where you feel like you should know your wines so fake it if you don't :)
author: Reyana F.

description:
Man...how have I never heard of this place?!?  My friend made reservations in advance for another friend's birthday; who knew this place was tucked away in the middle of a small alleyway?!  

You get a very cozy and home-like feel to this place, extremely spacious and they have a bocce ball court outside!  Make sure you call in advance to make reservations though.  Lovely little place to hang out with some friends, good food and good company.
author: Kevin C.

description: Truly impressed by the customer service I received tonight. Everyone was so friendly and welcoming but I do have to shout out Tim and Carissa. Tim, showed me the way through wine and good food! His recommendations mean everything. Listen to him when you're picking out a new wine to try. You won't regret it. :) Carissa brought her warmth and friendliness. Just a simple question and gesture made my night. Honestly one of the best experiences I've received in a long time. Thank you both and the whole team!!! I will be back with friends. Thank you for making my night and week so wonderful! Hidden Vine is definitely a hidden gem. ;)
author: Danielle W.

description:
Merchant St. The Hidden Vine is located on Merchant St. Merchant St. just sounds hidden. It sounds like where old money goes to throw back a couple of whiskeys and smoke cigars after work.

Needless to say, I have an overactive imagination.

Lucky for me though, the Hidden Vine is a wine bar (surprise!). And as someone who can't kick back that nice whiskey on the rocks, this is definitely the better alternative. 

The Hidden Vine feels like an old country home. Picture: big leather sofa seats and candle-lit rooms. It even *smells* like a home. This place feels exactly like where you would want to curl up into one of those big sofa seats and just read a book for hours and hours, except here, you get to drink wine. You get to eat cheese with quince paste and almonds. You get to eat charcuterie. How do you not come here?


Other notes:
(+) the waiters are wonderful and quirky and just as attentive as you want them to be. 
(+) the bread on the cheese/ meat boards are unlimited, so feel free to ask for more when you run out! (you will)
(+) cheese&meats are locally sourced.
(+) the space is small and will get packed. Not recommended as a last minute option for groups
(+) have an engagement party here, propose to your girlfriend here! this place is romantic, ooh la la! and will make special arrangements if you call ahead
author: Patricia K.

description:
This wine bar is considered one of the top wine bars in the country so I had pretty high expectations coming in. I'm not expert wino who drinks $150 wines regularly or anything (which I felt the staff didn't mind reminding me). I enjoy wine and wine tasting though so take that for what it is. The wine list isn't extensive but it is well-curated. One thing that surprised me was that there were not that many California wines. When I'm in California, I want California wines. I did notice an interesting comparison flight of a Napa vs. French red. 

I decided on the Big and Bold wine flight that included a set of mostly South American Teran, Shiraz and Malbec wines. The wines were big and bold but I would have liked a little more education on them. My favorite was probably the Teran. I also would have liked the flights to list the details of each wine next to it as opposed to having to flip to the other side to try to dig it out of the single glass list.

I also noticed there's no food menu here. I noticed that some reviews and the website includes food but I was not offered any- maybe because it was 11pm? I would have liked some water crackers or something to nibble on between wines. 

The ambience here is lovely and perfect for a date. 

All in all, I enjoyed my time here. It wasn't quite what I expected but I would come back.
author: Ninette C.

description:
So thrilled to end my evening at the Hidden Vine. My fiancé and I had started our evening at another nameless Tapas restaurant and quickly realized we needed to salvage our evening. And thank goodness for the recommendation of a friend we ended up here. 

Excellent wine list with not your run of the mill wines. We enjoyed the Chateau Patache bourdeaux blend while nibbling on some Marcona almonds. 

I was really looking forward to the grilled peaches flatbread but was so pleased when the server gave us our flatbread for free because the kitchen had run out of peaches and had substitute with apples. Excellent service!
author: Lori D.

description:
I love how the check comes tucked away in a book. Very cute.

The space itself is romantic and intimate, and it's a nice place to come with friends or a date. I only had one glass of moscato, and the three of us shared a beet salad and a mushroom pizza. The food was decent but not amazing, so maybe it's more of an after dinner spot.
author: Lisa S.

description: I've been here several times and it is a consistently good experience. Always a quaint spot, Cozy and homey feel that makes you forget your in the middle of downtown. They have a boccie ball court, but it's always been busy when I've visited (which I guess is a good thing!). The servers are very friendly and the overall ambiance is very relaxed. i love sitting on the couches, but the brick and mortar feel of this hidden gem makes any seat a good one. They have a good wine selection and tasty little snacks. I think they rotate their wine list, though I haven't noticed this in the past few months.Definitely a pleasant place to check out.
author: Zara S.

description:
What a winning location! This restaurant is discreetly tucked away from the mayhem of FiDi and transports you into a spacious, brick exposed, cabin like venue that serves local and imported wine that's too good to sip on. Then if you've got some liquid courage, bocce ball in the back alley awaits you.

Come to split a whole bottle with friends and be willing to meet others! Great for private parties too!
author: Regina D.

description:
Despite being hidden in an assuming alleyway, this place is a total gem. Very relaxed, classy, and intimate ambiance. Perfect for dates or small get-togethers because the environment + decor strike the perfect note. The place is lively but also calm and private. Reminds me of the typical posh NYC setting where yuppies come to catch up with their special girl(s) or boy(s) over a quiet Happy Hour. 

The Hidden Vine is close to my work and I brought a girlfriend here for her birthday on a Tuesday night. We shared a red wine flight and some of the appetizer plates. The wine selection was solid and our server was great about explaining the different flavors. Flatbread and burger slider plates are fairly small but perfect to share between two people. Wouldn't necessarily say the food items are especially hearty, diverse, or delicious but they make do. Typical wine bar food that is slightly sexy and slightly overpriced.
author: Arushi S.

description: Cool tucked away place. Decent wine selection. Great friendly staff. Cool relaxed decor and ambiance.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Wow - how the Hidden Vine has changed.

I can't believe that my last visit here was in 2006.

I didn't recognize the place this past week. The distinct European charm of Hidden Vine is no more. The Hidden Vine has emerged into a new era with a distinct chic, yet still cozy edge. It is the perfect spot for wine enthusiasts and those looking for a mellow night with conversation. They even carry a decent food menu, complete with hot tea for the non-drinkers.

Otis Redding crooned around us on their sound-system - as we caught up around flights of wine (I stuck with water).

Our waitress was attentive and time passed with ease - thanks to the well laid out space and acoustics. It was truly a lovely evening and I would highly recommend The Hidden Vine to anyone looking for a quality wine bar in the area.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I have been to Hidden Vine twice and really enjoyed myself both times!

The first time I went was to meet a friend for drinks after work. The atmosphere was casual yet classy, and the wine selection was solid. It was quiet enough to talk but still lively. 

The second time I went was for a work-sponsored happy hour. We had the outdoor bocce court reserved, which was nice. It was a cool space to hang out and mingle with co-workers. We had a few rounds of tasty hors d'oeurve and some nice bottles of wine. 

Overall, I would definitely recommend Hidden Vine for a variety of occassions.
author: Elise M.

description:
This is a cute nice wine bar located in like an alleyway hence the name hidden vine! 

We got the cali whites flights - 3 sample size whites for $13.. Reisling, sauvignon blanc, and something else (sorry i forgot the name!) i thought the price for the flights wasnt too bad. The trio selection is not too bad either. the vibe in here is nice.

They have an outdoor bocce ball!
They close at 1am but their kitchen closed at 10pm - i was able to taste their chocolate truffles delicious but  overpriced! ($9)

Just come here for some good wine and relaxing atmosphere (it can get loud sometimes but it dies down by late hours)
author: Stacy P.

description:
Amazing wine bar - this romantic spot and Amelie on Polk Street are my two favorites.  This may be my ultimate favorite, as it's quite romantic with a beautiful ambiance.  They also have a good wine selection, and I like that they have various wine flights, as sometimes I'm in the mood to do a flight vs. grab a glass.   Last week when were were there, I tried the Savingnon Blanc flight, which was a comparison of wines from CA, New Zealand, and France.  It was interesting to compare side by side.  

Both times we've stopped in here after work, it's been very busy (both times it was Friday around 6PM, so no surprise that it was busy, particularly given its location).  This past time we were at least lucky enough to grab two stools along the side wall closer to the kitchen/bathrooms.  The ambiance is better in the main area (more dimly lit, more comfortable chairs) if you're willing to wait.  

We also have tried some of their food options - the first time we tried the sliders, which were delicious.  This past time we ordered the warm citrus olives and burrata plate.  Oh my goodness, both were a delight.  My husband even devoured a healthy amount of olives, and he HATES olives in general.

Will be back for sure!  Would be great to stop back on a nice day and take advantage of their bocce ball court :)
author: Rachael S.

description: Honestly, I've never heard of this place prior to a friend having a birthday here. The interior is warm and comfortable with wooden accents. The furniture is over grown and comfortable - the type you can sink into over a good conversation with friends. The bocce ball court outside is an added bonus to an already comfortable lounge. Service is prompt and friendly. Only downfall is that the location is a bit far off and remote. Not a place I would come to normally, but if I was in the area again, I would definitely stop in for a drink or two.
author: Josh S.

description:
I was out and about with a friend this afternoon, and we decided some wine would be nice, so we googled to find the nearest wine places. Up came the Hidden Vine, which is tucked away on a side street. 

We checked it out, and the decor was relaxing yet classy. We settled in, and I enjoyed the Italian Red Blends wine flight while my companion ordered the bubbly comparison. All of the pours were sufficient and delicious, and we ordered some Sopressata/Manchego Bolsa as well as the Baby Spinach/Artichoke/etc Bolsa. All were delicious, with a flavorful filling and a perfectly baked (slightly gooey, as I like it) puff pastry crust. It was a nice, relaxing stop for some wine and a quick bite.
author: Peter S.

description:
Ambiance - 5 stars
Service - 5 stars
Wine - 5 stars
Chicken sliders - 5 stars
Sausage flatbread - 5 stars

The Italian and big bold red comparison pours are really cool ways to enjoy multiple wines.
author: Jay E.

description:
Great little wine bar. 

This place is dark and cozy and intimate. They've got couches and lots of different little nooks to relax. It's not small or cramped though. 

They have food and wine and it's a perfect place to meet up with a friend or date - wouldn't recommend for colleagues (unless there is a little more there...).
author: Stephanie M.

description: Nice discovery off a side alley in the bustling financial district.   Love the understated dark ambience and old brick walls and a fireplace.   Behind the bar is a huge wine cabinet filled with wonderful selections throughout California and Europe.  Can order glasses or paired tastes of various red and white.  One may also order tapas if desired as well.  In our case, we came for an after dinner drink and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly at a nice round wooden table.   Service was attentive and efficient.  Great experience overall.
author: Roy A.

description:
I had really high expectation to this place. It's a very cute location, and menu looks really appealing. However, it's nothing like the other ppl reviewed on Yelp. My experience was not quite exciting. 

1. The place is really noisy. It was a Wednesday and not to mention it's Veteran's day. You would expect ppl behave well in a wine bar not a real bar. The tables are super close to each other, I felt like I went to a club after yelling to my friend.

2. The service is pretty slow. No one showed to help me and the server was always rushed to go to somewhere else. Most importantly, my friend wanted a recommendation of a fruity, aromatic wine. It turned out they recommended a very smoky cali wine. 

3. The price was scary too. We ordered two small pieces of cheese, some sampler of ham / prosciutto, and two glasses of wine. It was $50/person at the end

I will not go back to this place. Also not recommend for those of you who want to try out
author: Taoran F.

description:
This place reminds me my rich friend's living room in Napa! 

Ok. That's a lie because I don't have a rich friend who lives in Napa, much less, know anybody who has a living room that looks like THIS. 

The ambiance is refined but unpretentious. Dark, lots of wood and exposed brick. Plenty of leather chairs and velvet sofas to sink into. The coveted seats are the ones right in front of the cast-iron fireplace. This wine bar is romantic enough for a date, but more as a pre-dinner stop or closer to closing time, because even at 8:30pm on a Thursday, this place was buzzin with young professionals and business people with their clients. There was also a couple of guys enjoying the bocce ball court, probably the only one in this part of town!

There are 40 wines by the glass with prices ranging from $8-$18 and the list focuses mainly on Californian and Italian wines. I tried a 2010 Italian white of the Cortese varietal and it reminded me of a Pinot Grigio: light bodied, crisp and citrus-y.  My brother who knows all about hard liquor and nothing about wine just said, "pick something cold for me!"  I think he liked the 2009 Riesling from the Willamette Valley in Oregon, but what he REALLY loved were the XOX truffles. For $9, we got 8 truffles served in a cute mason jar: red wine, Kahlua, French Roast and Framboise flavors. They were all delicious.

It's a bit tricky finding this place, my brother thought I was leading him to a shady looking alley in the Financial District. He is 6'2" and 200 pounds, no meat head would wanna mess with him. But in case you're concerned, bring your own bodyguard.
author: Janice C.

description:
Yelp does it again!

After a quick stop at Off the Grid, the four of us were looking for a quiet bar for a Friday night double date.

We wanted to be able to enjoy a drink instead of getting beer spilled on us and we also wanted to hear each other talk instead of taking turns yelling in each other's ear the entire night. I Yelped "quiet bar" and was not disappointed.

The Hidden Vine provided us with that and more. The place is beyond romantic. The dim lighting, soft music and large comfortable sectionals give you no choice but to cozy up to your S.O..

Regarding the menu, the four of us ordered four different wines, all of which were delicious. We also had some cheese and charcuterie plates, olives and toasted almonds, all A-Okay.

Perfect for a date, double date, or small group. We will be back!
author: Teiki K.

description:
Love this spot. The wine and food is always good, the service is friendly, and the prices are reasonable for the neighborhood.

It's a little hidden, but well worth the walk. 

The atmosphere is great too - cozy, dimly lit and the fauteuilles are crazy comfortable. It's perfect for a date just as well as a drink with friends.

Just make sure you make a reservation or get there early. It's tough to find a table after 6:30 on week days.
author: Sophie B.

description:
This place is too good for its location - it should be in hayes or mission!  That said, if I worked nearby, I'd be psyched to have this kind of gem in my hood.  

Super masculine, stylish decor... cozy mix of couches, plush chairs, and high-tops arranged to give each group of people privacy.  Approachable menu of small bites and excellent curated wine list by the glass.  Service was great too - had us in and out with food in our stomach in 20 minutes.
author: Gracie L.

description: Just okay for me. I think the vibe it a little mature for my taste. I prefer a more lively environment. Also we wanted to play bocce ball but apparently someone else reserved it.
author: Jane H.

description:
Greatly disappointed. The place looks great and was definitely packed. However, the wine selection was limited as was the appetizers. I ordered an $11 Tempranillo first. I know it's cheap, but the waitress said it was full bodied. It was rather weak for my tastes. I ordered the burrata plate since it is raved about. With this I ordered a CabFranc. The burrata plate was rather standard as in Trader Joes.  And my CabFranc came out chilled.
And to ice it, on both sides of me were Match.com dates. It was painful.
author: George S.

description: I've been to the Hidden Vine a few times - with friends and co-workers.  This place is very intimate and fairly good for conversation (although can get loud).  Nice restaurant - exposed brick, fun atmosphere - including bocce ball outside.  It is a little dark, but that makes it cozy.  Would recommend!
author: Renee F.

description:
SO nice with an upscale, trendy vibe. Wine is decently priced and I loved being able to try their comparison tasting in which you can select two similar wines. We also had a burrata dish and the sliders. Really good! 

Crowd is a bit older but we actually really liked that for a relaxing wine bar to go to after work. It's a bit hidden down an alley way, all the more adding to its ambiance.
author: Joanne H.

description: Met someone here because they live in Chinatown. It's a nice spot. I am around wine drinkers in my family, but not that into wine. We got a bottle of Pellegrino sparkling water and I had pickled vegetables. It was packed so we sat up front by the door. Great ambiance.
author: Denise C.

description: A cool, not overrun place w bocce ball and very attentive service. good spot for a weekend night - easy parking and not crowded. Overall, it was a pleasure coming here. Kitchen closes a bit early.
author: Andrew K.

description:
A group of us stopped in last Friday after a number of other bars we tried to go to were either a) way, way too loud, b) closed too early (before 11:00PM on a Friday night, seriously???), or c) booked for private company holiday events. 

I hate to repeat this phrase again, but it really is a hidden gem! It's in this small, unassuming alleyway, but once you walk in it has a nice, intimate feeling. It was dimly lit and quiet inside, which was really nice. They also have a few really comfy couches for you to lounge on, which was great after a night walking around the city.

The waitress was also really quick to bring out our drinks and was great at giving us some recommendations.
author: Jessica J.

description: I completely agree with previous posters that the atmosphere and ambience are wonderful. Very intimate and cozy amidst the hustle of the financial district. However for a wine bar with a very simple menu I found the service to be inattentive and slow. Each order required multiple requests to the waitstaff when they could be found.
author: N A.

description: WATCH OUT if you're looking to book this place for a work/team event. A larger company was coming in after us, and the staff warned us every 15 minutes that our time was ending. No respect for our time, didn't care that we were there. When we walked in, they told us that every other place in the bar was reserved. Then, they charged us auto-gratuity of 18%- while prepping other tables for other party's arrivals. Inappropriate and rude! For a party of 20 or less, look out.
author: Sarah N.

description: Do not come here or even contact them to coordinate a group event. A coworker has reached out to them to ask about options for a big group of 30-40 and was told they're not very nice. Too bad considering we are bringing business and we are an established company in the bay area. I will be telling my colleagues not to do business with them and you shouldn't either.
author: Hazel Q.

description:
It's definitely a little pricey and can get packed in the evening but if you want you feel cool with your friends, take them down this small alley into the unassuming brick front and enjoy a relaxing evening of good drinks.

I tend to go on the earlier side when they've just opened to avoid the crowds but always a relaxing spot to hit on the weekends.
author: Josh R.

description: A little busy, but the traffic is well-deserved. It's a gem in the FiDi, complete with tasty food and a bocce court. Great for after work.
author: Kelly B.

description:
First time to the new location. It was awesome although it feels very different from the old location, which is very homey. 

The new location is good for after work drink. The glass room in the front is  cool for a private party. Love the glass wall set up. It's open but subtle. 

Of course, their wine selection is great as usual. Food are awesome, strongly recommend thyme and citrus marinated olives, very special.
author: Shell J.

description:
Went for pre dinner drinks.

1. Decor is a bit more old school (it's not ugly, just not to my liking) and service is alright.
2. 3 of us had a wine flight each (9 total). I think all of them were pretty good.
3. The cheese was good as well.
author: Samuel W.

description:
Despite always being packed, I really like the ambiance that the Hidden Vine offers. Very romantic and inviting - great for dates or small group gatherings with close friends (2-5 people).

Really like that their wines by the glass are separated by New World vs Old World (this applies to both the red & whites section). Glasses range from $10-$17 each. They also have a variety of flights ($12-$15) with 3 choices in each flight. In addition, they serve a few locally brewed draft beers ($6).

Great selection in small eats, too. Great for sharing - Charcuterie ($7 each or $30 for 5 types), Cheese ($6 each or $25 for 5 types), Flat breads ($10), & Sliders ($12-$14).

Just outside the wine bar in the back, they also have a small Bocce lane. I haven't played but always saw it being utilized!

Get there early to snag seats or expect to wait for a table!
author: Veronica S.
