description: Solid place to hang out and have some wine. The somms somewhat know what they're doing and that's plenty. They have a decent selection of wine but I really just like the ambiance of the place. Quiet and chill.
author: Moses S.

description: I had an amazing time here tonight. My friend and I came for a drink after dinner and I couldn't have been more pleased. I had the red blend flight and she had the Pinot noir.  We also tried the truffles which were delicious. The staff is very attentive and sweet. The music is perfect for a chill atmosphere. Oh and there's a bocce court right outside the door. I'll definitely be back!
author: Christine B.

description: The service was above and beyond. You can tell they care about your experience. Jesse was exceptional! You really can't go wrong with their puff pastries. Fabulous appetizers and even better seduction of wine. I would recommend this to anyone who cares about a stellar date night. Thanks guys for making it memorable!!!'
author: Andrew B.

description: The Hidden Vine is a hidden gem. Finding a place in SF city where I can unwind after work with good wine and food is harder than it should be. This place offers an exceptional list of rotating wines (red, white, and bubbles), and I've yet to be let down. Atmosphere is "casual intimate" - cozy enough for 1:1 conversation and welcoming to groups. Their food is delicious (get the sausage flatbread), service is present and friendly without being obtrusive, and they have an outdoor bocce ball court! Overall, I highly recommend checking out the Hidden Vine.
author: Julia W.

description: Chef Lex is so talented that he ought to be immortalized in a sculpture of crab cakes
author: Rachel N.

description: Exceptional experience. A beautiful, intimate space-- great for a date. Good wine selection and  I enjoyed the cheeses offered. Bartenders were very kind, charged my phone for me without question, and double checked on my food allergy to make sure the food ordered was safe to eat. I wish Boston had a sister location because I would surely be a regular. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Sam H.

description:
Great romantic date spot. 

It feels like a wealthy relative's library or living room. There are semi-private nooks for intimate conversations. The wine options are top-notch and the sommelier knows her stuff.
author: Kim C.

description: The wine selection is really boring but I love the ambience of this place. Comfortable seating and I like their kitchen selection. Wouldn't mind checking the out again, nice place for a date.
author: Tiff W.

description:
Great place to have girl time! 

Awesome wine and appetizer selection. It's a very chill atmosphere and nice that people do not talk so dang loud. 

Very cozy indeed!
author: Spooky E.

description:
Although they do not have a happy hour, this place is pretty awesome, and it seems that everyone else in the Fi Di agrees.  They open at 4 pm and are completely packed by 5 pm.  So come early to grab good seats.  

Atmosphere: dark and moody, but your eyes get used to it.  Awesome 80's music in the backgound! Comfy chairs, a really cozy couch in one corner, and a large (somewhat segregated) communal table, which large parties can often usurp.  Exposed brick and wooden beams = can i move in? Tends to get loud though.

Wine/bites: I had two glasses of an amazing off-dry Riesling that our waiter recommended. $9 a glass.  I also tried my co-worker's rose bubbly and it was actually really nice, and not too sweet.  We also ordered two different types of cheeses - an Italian sheep's milk and one with truffles - and they were both really tasty.  Cheese came with fresh bread, almonds and fruit jam (apricot?).  They also offer other nibbles like flatbreads and marinated olives.  

Service: spotty.  The gentleman that first helped us was affable and knowledgeable. Another employee (seating hostess maybe) though, at some point, rolled her eyes at a question I asked.  But I was drunk by that point so I didn't really care.

I will definitely return!!!!
author: Gev M.

description: Expansive but lovely. What a hidden gem! I recommend this place to all my friends in the financial district.
author: Lizzie O.

description: This place might be good for a couple or few people going in for a glass of wine.  But do not book your corporate event, party or any type of group activity here.  They will be over priced and treat you like a second class citizen.  A customer service is simply not to SF's expectations.
author: morfin k.

description:
In town for the night and wanted a nice wine bar to go to so I went to Yelp for suggestions. We headed to The Hidden Vine because of the great reviews and that many yelpers couldn't be wrong!
Super cute inside and what a good selection of whites! The French white flight was amazing and so was the flatbread. Aaron, behind the bar, was very nice and knowledgeable. Can't wait to go back again!
author: Rebecca H.

description: Really cute wine bar with an ambiance perfect for date night/post-date night! The Hidden Vine has a nice wine selection at reasonable prices. I also used to like coming here after work to grab a glass of wine with coworkers back when I worked in the Embarcadero.
author: Cici A.

description:
I tried out the Hidden Vine with a few girlfriends on a Monday evening and we loved it! We assumed it wouldn't be too crowded on a Monday around 8 pm, but we were wrong...so many people! We went in hoping to not wait too long for a table and to our surprise, the waitress kindly offered us the big long table in a private room, for just the 4 of us (it could probably seat 8). We immediately were taken by the ambiance - cute, cozy and yes, hip. I had read so many good things and bookmarked this place on Yelp, and the hype definitely lived up to the wait. 

We each ordered a flight of wine - I went with the Riesling flight (California & Germany, which, according to my research and taste-tests, both tend to be on the sweeter end of Rieslings). I loved it! One was slightly more tart (I think the California...? #wineconnoisseur) and the other was sweeter, but both were absolutely delicious. For $9 you get a pretty sizable pour of both options too! We also ordered the mushroom flatbread - delicious! Definitely would want to try some more of the small plates next time (sliders mmm). 

Tips:
+get there early enough for a cozy little table or call in advance
+try a flight - you get to sample more! 
+tell your waiter what types of wines/tastes you like and they can recommend / let you taste-test before you order
+make your next date / classy night with your girlfriends here! 

I will definitely be back!
author: Anu P.

description:
When certain places live up to their name, there can be negative connotations. Take this place: The Hidden Vine. I will explain.

Location is tucked away in an alley, but that is not the primary reason I would call it "hidden." Upon ordering two drinks for the group, including a NV Le Vigne du Alice Prosecco from Veneto, Italy, I'd say at least 15 minutes passed with no drinks received. Two servers were reminded a total of three times that our drinks had not arrived yet. VERRRY hidden.

Eventually also got a Simonsig Pinotage. Came *slightly* quicker to the table, but speed isn't what they're known for here.
author: Garett T.

description: My wife and I enjoyed an evening at The Hidden Vine. The staff was friendly and very helpful, the wine selection was great and the food was a perfect compliment to our wine.
author: Rich M.

description: Came after work for glass of wine and a nibble (buratta, prosciutto, and pear crostini).  The wine and the nibble were damn good.  The atmosphere is cozy, trendy, and cool all at the same time.  It ain't cheap, but it's damn good.
author: Steve C.

description:
Wanted to check out a new wine spot & randomly picked this location. It was just what I was looking for: soothing atmosphere, knowledgeable staff, scrumptious food & wine list that doesn't disappoint. 

The burrata was breathtaking & the spicy sausage flatbread was delectable! I will definitely be returning to try other items.
author: M G.

description:
This is one of my favorite spots for a glass of wine in SF. The wine selection is not huge, but it's well curated and it changes every so often. The cheese boards and nibbles are also very good. I love the fact that they warm up the olives! 
There's a small "semi-private" room with a beautiful tapestry on the wall and the main room with comfy armchairs and some high tables. Perfect spot for a date!
author: Anna J.

description:
The place is nice. It has a similar decor to the battery club, kinda like a luxury gentleman's room. The drinks were nothing special and a bit expensive,  the waiter was very nice. 

I can take it or leave it. In summary: okay for a date. Too expensive/snobby for hanging with friends.
author: Serina J.

description:
Pros: Great selection, cozy, nice deco, bocce ball
Cons: busy

I went here with a group of 5 ladies around 7pm on a Wednesday. It was completely full except a spot outside next to Bocce. The hostess was really nice by helping scope out options even though it is open seating. This is my only real complaint with Hidden Vine, but it isn't their fault that they are awesome and people want to hangout there. 

The wine selection was broad but not overwhelming. I felt like there were a good number of options in various price ranges. I got a German Riesling that was delightful. The other got sparkling wines, which they said were great. The bar tender was attentive and nice, which is a truly winning and rare combo in SF. 

The decor was super cozy. I loved that it sort of felt like a fancy living room. Comfortable club chairs, faux fire, super large communal table.

I will definitely be back!
author: Laura W.

description:
LA LA LOVVVED this place!

My coworkers and I went for happy hour.  I fell in love right when we walked in, as I do with most dimly lit, romantic-looking restaurants.  The venue is on the smaller side, so it was pretty packed as we arrived.  We ordered wine flights at the bar and a kind waitress kept an eye out for us for a table (everything is first come first serve during happy hour).  We were able to snag a great table with couches in about 30 or so minutes. 

The food was SO delicious!  We ordered a cheese plate and all 3 of their Flatbreads.  The Wild Mushroom and Fennel Sausage Flatbreads were absolutely delicious, but the Pancetta Flatbread blew me away! 

Can't wait to go back here, hopefully sooner than later!
author: Suki B.

description:
I had an amazing experience at Hidden Vine. Like the name entails, the cute little bar is located inside a small alleyway at the heart of Financial District.

The best part of my experience was the service and the price! I got the monthly special Rose flight, which was only $10 for 3 2oz glasses! My boyfriend got the Light and Crisp flight, and that was regular price, but just $3 more. 

When our server brought us our wine he, after making sure we were there to appreciate the wine rather than trying to get hammered, explained each of the wines in the flight. I think his intro made the drinking experience that much more special.

I would come back here again for the service and the awesome price! They apparently also have a Bocce ball setup outside. I definitely need to try that next time.
author: Vivian W.

description: Fantastic mood, wine...i will be back. Friendly staff and great music.... Late nightcap.
author: Tim P.

description:
It's extremely easy to not find this place, especially when it's dark.
I'd bookmarked this place for 2 reasons:
1) Wine/Champagne flights.
2) Bocce Ball, indoors.

I didn't try the latter. But my friend & I did try the wine flights. Whilst we were pondering over the next steps to take in life.
The ambiance is very romantic - ergo, dim lights, not very intrusive service. So, I wouldn't come here with a big group. Unless, it's a doube/triple/quadruple date thing. 

We sat at the bar and it was a relatively quiet night, seeing as it was Tuesday night. Service was attentive yet aloof. Perfect, IMHO.

Between the two of us, we tried the Big & Bold flight  and the Sauvignon Black(France, New Zealand & CA) flight. I also ended up trying the Moroccan Rose (which if you ask me, is perfect since it's not ridiculously sweet or zinny). I will definitely be back to try out the other wines. I like the eclectic mix of wines they have on their menu. Don't see that very often. They do serve food as well. The mushroom flatbread looked ridiculously delicious. So, must try that too.

Not very expensive. Total bill came to about $45 for the both of us. Could have used a bit more alcohol though :)
author: Ranjani S.

description: Love the romantic dimly lit ambiance. Wouldn't be in the FiDi on the weekend if it wasn't for this place. The brick building and interior decor make it feel like you're in a time capsule away from the City-- very Chicago-esque vibe. The wine selection was excellent!
author: Lissette L.

description: Really liked this place. Came here for a quick drink between work and dinner with my wife. Super cozy and had a great wine list. The staff is fantastic and offered to take our picture when we were looking like idiots trying to take selfies. Super friendly. We will be back to check out the bocce at some point down the road.
author: Dennis C.

description: It might be "hidden", but it's definitely a gem!! Great selection of wines and delicious food, even for us vegetarians! Service was excellent as well. Highly recommended!
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Wine & Outdoor Bocce in the City. 

This is a classy joint, tucked away in an alley that you could only be so lucky to stumble upon. It has a very romantic vibe so I recommend it for a date night but it would also be great for after work drinks. The bocce courts are a major plus but this place could stand on its own without them.
author: Jen N.

description: A neat wine bar and the name is appropriate as the place is really hidden from main streets.  We had just arrived in the city and were looking for a casual dinner near our hotel.  Using Yelp we noted the high scores and it was close by.  We arrived as a party of four and entered the dark interior spaces.  The Hidden Vine has an extremely casual operation, you just grab any open table or snag a sofa space.  The wine menu is mind boggling diverse with much of Europe well covered.  The food menu is limited but good quality.  Overall I'd like this place more if interior spaces had better lighting.  We almost had to use iPhone flashlight app to read the menus. Also part of wine appreciation is being able to see the wine... and here I was simply trying to see the glass!
author: L. D.

description: It is really hidden. I would not find it if Yelp reviews didn't happen. The atmosphere was so beautiful and relaxing. Service was fast, and the staff was so helpful. I tried Jean-Pierre. It was a little sweetie. At least it's worth to allocate a half an hour for a glass of wine when you stop by the Merchant St.
author: Irfan K.

description:
I got a little scared this weekend when we were looking for this place.  We had some time to kill before the husband's company party so we looked for wine bars in the general area and this one popped up.  GPS led us on a short trek that ended in a really sketchy alley with an overflowing dumpster and a huge truck blocking, like, everything.  I thought we were gonna get shanked or something....but then we rounded the dumpster, passed some Eastern European café, and finally spotted the entrance.  

The Hidden Vine was indeed hidden, but once we were inside, the contrast made it worth the search.  It's set up like someone's Mad Men den, with deep chairs in clusters around low tables, a fireplace, and a couple high-tops with comfy-looking bar chairs.  You could be wearing a smoking jacket like Hugh Hefner and feel totally at home.  We decided to sit at the bar though because service would be faster that way.  The wine list isn't as extensive as I'd hoped (okay, when we looked online ahead of time I spotted a Ripasso that I had my heart set on but it wasn't available when we arrived...so that's not fair, the wine list is actually pretty comprehensive, I'm just being butthurt).  Lots of whites and reds (and two roses) divided up between old world and new world, with some surprising ones I'd never even heard of and certainly couldn't pronounce.  Several snacks are available including crab sliders but we'd already eaten so I guess we'll have to come back again to check that all out.  Service was prompt and courteous, and prices were reasonable for everything.  So yeah, we'll be back....I'll just make sure to keep my mace in the front pocket of my smoking jacket for that freaky-ass alley.
author: Heather K.

description:
Cute little wine place hidden in an alley. 

I like it because it's never overly crowded ( or at least when I've gone ) 

I like the atmosphere of the place and they have really great wine selections as well.
author: Jessica C.

description:
this place is one of my favorite wine bars!
thers a feeling of antiquity but cool
they serve great wines and cowgirl creamery cheese :)
author: Marie r.

description: Really don't have much to say other than this place was so nice, intimate and one of the overall best lounges I've been in SF. Great and friendly staff as well and wonderful wine and cheese plates. Will definitely be coming back here, thank you!
author: George B.

description: This is a hidden gem. It is tucked away in an alley but WOW. Great atmosphere and great wine. The waiter, Cassidy was beyond fantastic. You don't get this kind of service in a great restaurant let alone a cozy wine bar. The wild mushroom flatbread was delicious. Highly recommend to everyone.
author: Ken R.

description:
This name is very appropriate as the bar is totally hidden. Other than a small sign, you could walk right by and completely miss it. Inside is dimly lit and cozy - perfect for a date or catch up session with a friend. 

Post work yesterday this small bar was crowded, but we were still able to find a table for 2. My friend had a glass of the malbec and I had a glass of the zinfandel on recommendation from our server (who was very knowledgeable). The wine list is definitely pricey (as wine bars tend to be), glasses between $10-20. They also offer a few wine flights but we didn't get that fancy.

We were both starving so we ordered some snacks off their menu for dinner: the bacon flatbread, sausage flatbread, and the beef sliders. The flatbreads were delicious! Very small, but delicious. The sliders were ok, there was a spicy jam on them that overwhelmed the rest of the flavors. 

The only downside of this place is that after a second round of wine our bill came to $90. Yikes!
author: Rachel E.

description:
This is a chíc and trendy place to meet friends or colleagues after work for wine & delicious accompaniments. The atmosphere is low key and somewhat mysterious due to the limited and indirect lighting. 

Cassidy was super helpful and recommended a fabulous fruit-forward New World 2008 Malbec by Sempre Vive of Napa. By the glass was only $16 (but 50% off with a Yelp Check-in during your 1st visit). Bonus!

The food offerings looked amazing but I only stopped in for libations. Next time!
author: Tamia G.

description:
eh, maybe this just isnt a place 8 young ladies should kick back and relax before dinner.

It is located in a hotel and it a very small, low-key and chill spot in the back of the very small lobby.  There is this old home library feel when you enter with the dark decor and dim lighting.  It is a pretty cool setting if you are looking to relax with a friend to catch up or unwind with a significant other.

However, on this visit, we were just starting a night out with the ladies and decided to grab a drink here before dinner.  There were only about 6 other people there when we arrived and only one bartender/waiter.  He must have been having an off night cause he pretty much sucked.  He was extremely slow and not very attentive.  When we inquired about some things on the menu, there were no distinct answers or suggestions, that was a huge fail.

I did get to taste 3 great Rieslings so that was a nice treat and I had a great time getting to know the girls I was with so it was nice in that way.  I don't think I would be excited to go back to this place though as it seemed we did not fit in very well nor did we receive good service.  

Not impressed - wish they would step their game up at least on the service!!
author: Colleen B.

description:
This place has some pretty good wine at decent prices. 

I came here on a date and sat on the couch. It's a great place in Financial District. 

I'll have to suggest it as a place for happy hour with friends - however the only disappointing part of it is that there are no happy hour prices for wine. 

Charming location for a date and close to work!
author: Nina Y.

description:
ATMOSHPERE:
HIdden vine got hidden Bocce ball! That's pretty unique. In the middle of FiDi if you want to do something a little bit different than just drink. Now you can drink AND throw balls around! 

11.24.13
author: Angela L.

description: We were looking for a venue to host a small milestone birthday, and the Hidden Vine was perfect! We reserved the communal room and bocce court, and our guests flowed freely between them all night. The staff was responsive and accommodating, from the very beginning with our first email correspondence and all the way through the end of the night. While for us it was perfect for our party, it is also an amazing venue for a date night or small group. Get there early to get a seat - while "hidden," it is also super popular!
author: J K.

description:
DISCLAIMER:  I am NOT a wine connoisseur!  I either like it or I don't and am FAR from a wine expert!  Wine bars are NOT my part of my normal haunts ... I'm more of a full bar, type of guy.

Came here with L.A. this past Tues.  Given my lack of expertise on the subject of wine, I enjoyed this place.  Very nice decor and comfortable place.  What I really liked is the WIDE variety of wines they had from around the world ... the wine list DEFINITELY wasn't Napa/Sonoma/CA centric.

The server recommendations on wine were very good and the overall service was good (not stellar).  Had one of their flat bread appetizers ... good, but not stellar.

I didn't see the boccie ball court until later, but a nice little fun touch to the place.  Most glasses of wine will cost between $14 and $20.

I'd come again.
author: Richard F.

description:
Great atmosphere.   Bocce garden...cool people


Fantastic for a group or as a getaway to hideout
author: S E.

description:
Great wine and cheese selection. 

Also the perfect place to watch awkward first Tinder dates in the wild. Riveting.
author: Casey M.

description: Fantastic wine selection with charcuterie plate. The place is intimate and the staff know's the menu well. Good for a date or small group of friends. Large groups look tough to accommodate on the fly.
author: Scott K.

description:
I went here for a private party recently on a Tuesday afternoon, and it was awesome. It's a little hard to find, so if you see an alley way with a german looking place, look next door and you'll find it. 

The ambiance is great! I loved the set up and the wait staff was super delightful. The wine was impeccable and the appetizers were very well portioned and easy to eat whilst drinking the wine. I would reccommend coming with a few people as it's a nice place to chat, but it is kind of quiet. 

The crowd that came in as our party was leaving was a little on the older side though, early 30s type. Otherwise, I'd love to come back for a classy happy hour.

I will mention that one of the waitresses did get kind of pushy near then end when our party was leaving, she kept telling us to move so that the next party could sit at out table....even though they weren't there yet and we could have stayed a bit longer and bought more drinks...up until then though, they were great!

PS The Bocce ball game is fun, but its outside so bring a jacket!
author: Molly S.

description: Great find! Adorable little wine bar offering a small private space for parties and open space for happy hour or sharing a bottle with friends. The bar needs a few more varietals I think they could offer to make it a bit more sppealibg. We left as we drank what looked good on a flight and left to move on at another bar. I'd definitely go back and check it out or recommend it to a friend.  Close to parking lots and restaurants.
author: Lisa, L.

description:
We stopped by here for a glass of wine the other night and were pleasantly surprised!

This little hidden gem had a wonderful atmosphere + the wine selection was superb! We also had an order of truffles for dessert that were melt-in-your-mouth delicious.
The staff was knowledgeable and attentive.

I would definitely go back!
author: Nelli S.

description:
I am so proud of the way staff conducted themselves at this place! I was looking for a bar near the Embarcadero to have a Meetup for the opening of BEASTS OF THE SOUTHERN WILD. So I searched for places in the area and Google searched bars. I saw the Hidden Vine listed and figured I'd take a shot. I was a little hesitant because some places immediately start acting funny when I mention the International Black Women's Film Festival --they think "Uh-oh. Black people! I bet they're going to be pouring champagne on each other and doing booty dances on the table." Needless to say, my experiences with some venues/bars in the Bay Area have been hit-or-miss. 

Emailed and called the place to reserve the "groups" area which is really a little spot tucked off the main entrance with a beautiful Spanish style table. The initial interaction was smoother and more professional than I'd experienced in some time. They weren't pushing for payment on the first contact, but they spelled out the terms, confirmed what I needed and set a reasonable price. With that, I was glad to pay. There was no "funny stuff" like special stipulations that only apply to "special" groups, you know, like we need you to bring CASH or a CASHIER'S CHECK right now --no exceptions.

They were genuinely professional. Got to the place the day off, and like all of my events, the group was diverse in ages, races and looks --that to say that you never know how you or your guests are going to be treated, because apparently some bar/restaurant/venue staff were raised in cloistered convents and have never seen different kinds of people before.

There was a designated staff person who was professional, courteous and attentive, and all business around the reservation was handled out of ear shot of the guests, specifically things like double-checking what was ordered, how I wanted the service timed, etc. FANTASTIC!

The wine was amazing and guests were truly impressed by the place. No one was made to feel that they didn't belong, there were no side-eyes, no suspiciously frequent "check-ins", no rude treatment, etc. It was nothing but professional service, attention to hospitality and great wine.

They didn't even get nervous when Mardi Gras beads came out, or when the producer of BEASTS OF THE SOUTHERN WILD, Josh Penn, stopped by as the guest of honor. 

I love this place and I highly recommend it. I've been recommending it to people at my job, film industry professionals, et al., because they deserve the accolades. Oh, and they have THE BEST wine glasses I've seen in quite some time. Classy with a "c". No posers, obnoxious hipsters or socially stunted techies because they definitely set the bar high on what is acceptable behavior at this place!

Cheers to the Hidden Vine Wine Bar!
author: Adrienne A.

description: Very nice spot. Bocce ball court in back. Nice wine selection from Europe and the US and knowledgable about the wines offered. Overall highly recommend. Especially like that the check was brought in a book!
author: Therese M.

description:
Cute little Wine Bar down a little alley, the "pourer" (Not sure exactly what she is called, she did everything) was very helpful and friendly. They have a huge selection of wine. They also have some food. I had the sliders.... Not the best but were decent.

I just loved the ambiance! I wish I could decorate my house just like it!

Would love to go back soon!
author: Samuel C.

description: Wonderful date spot. The lighting is dim which makes for an intimate atmosphere. It's normally neither dead or over-crowded. The chairs are particularly comfy. There's a fireplace crackling. The wine's a little expensive but that's to be expected. The waitstaff is great. I love this place... I've impressed many dates here.
author: Jacob N.

description:
I met a friend here for happy hour one Friday evening.  I like the ambiance, it is as if you are walking into someone's living room.  I got there before my friend so I sat in the chairs by the fireplace.  The prices of the wines do tend to get a bit pricey, however I like that they offer flights so that you can have a taste of a variety.  Plus the tastings are generous which is helpful.  It takes about 3 sips of wine to really get the true flavors of the wine.   I loved the Argentina Malbec wines.  

My only complaint is there was a party sitting next to me with a baby that cried.  I just don't think that was the place to bring a baby, let alone a child.

A very inviting and intimate place tucked away in a small alley street.  It is as if you are in Europe.
author: Liz D.

description:
What a delight to find.  With all the places to choose from for a couple glasses of wine, it is a daunting challenge to get it right.  I definitely feel like this was a great pick.  The wine selection was solid.  A wide range of flavors for all.  The server was extremely knowledgeable and NOT condescending.  She was great in asking the right questions to help steer us towards some great wines.  

    The small plate menu was just right and delicious.  And by the way...did you know there is a Bocce Court here?   WHO KNEW.  You can also reserve the Bocce court as it was that night.  I will go back for the wine..and hope for some Bocce next time.

     It was full, but far from crowded just there was a nice atmosphere about the place.  A great place for a date or small group of friends to catch up.
author: Michael A.

description:
It was love at first sight :) 

Came in around 6pm on a Friday night and the place was full, good sign #1.  We only waited about 10 minutes before a table opened up.  The wait staff were all so friendly and attentive, love it when that happens!  Special shout-out to Cassidy who took such good care of us - super friendly and helpful.

The wines were fun to try - you have the option of wines by the glass or bottle, flights of 3 @ 2oz each or comparisons of 2 @ 3oz each.  Prices are fair and the pours are honest.  We only tried one flatbread - the pancetta one, it was delicious! 

Such a good decision to ring in the weekend with a stop at Hidden Vine - I will come back again and again!
author: Brianna M.

description:
Nice staff and a great selection of wine by the glass (about $10-$17). This place is tucked away in the Financial District, and it is warm and cozy. 

They have a pretty sizable food menu, but I didn't try anything this time. Since I'll be back, I'll be sure to try it then.
author: Colleen K.

description: Great place to hang out with small group of friends and enjoy their wine and food.
author: Veve S.

description:
Now I usually don't come to FiDi when the sun goes down.  It's concrete lack luster vibe is an immediate turn off for most evenings.  The Hidden Vine is one of the few exceptions that drag folks out to the neighborhood.  

Brick walls, an extensive wine list, and a cozy atmosphere bursting with character - this makes for a great date spot or a chatty evening with girlfriends.  Bocce ball is a plus...bocce ball after a glass of wine maybe my new favorite sport.
author: Nikki G.

description:
The Hidden Vine is a pure delight, with creative flights and delicious morsels. I know Jonathan Gold complains that San Francisco is "shuddering through its mannerist phase," but sometimes it pays off. Here you can get a venison rillette with a selection of cold Portuguese whites, and it's glorious.

On a mid-week afternoon, the interior buzzes with boisterous office workers and canoodling couples. It can get a bit loud and crowded, yet remains polite. With the exception of a enormous tapestry in the front room, the decor is a bit spare. But they've got bocce ball outside (or something resembling it), so all is forgiven.

For quality wine, it's also quite affordable. They have whites beginning at $7 a glass and the pours are generous. Staff is well-informed and friendly, while its unusual location keeps out the tourists. So drink up, knowing the workaday world outside is but a passing nuisance.
author: Karl H.

description:
As an update to my review, shortly after the first review, the general manager contacted me and made a compelling offer for another chance. We were impressed by the offer and thought we'd try, as many establishments would ignore the problem keep business as usual. Sometimes things just don't go as planned and hopefully for them, this was just one of those off days. 

So, we returned last weekend, and while we went much earlier (right at opening) and had complete different service staff, we were much more impressed and very satisfied with the wine flight as well as the cheese plate we got. 

The service was good as well, but again, we were the only ones there. I do take back my original thought of never returning and we will come back again on a busy night and hope it goes as well. I also raise my my review to 4 stars.
author: Ben A.

description: Wide selection of wine. Better to get a bottle if you're in a big group. They also have some games outside. Bocce ball? Or maybe it was shuffle board. I didn't go outside to look, but my friends seemed to enjoy it.  Didn't get a chance to try the food, but it looked decent. Nice quiet place to catch up with friends and decent service.
author: Lisa T.

description:
After reading a review on Sosh, I decided to check this place out with a group of friends.  We made a reservation for bocce online (very easy, I was able to do it from my iphone browser).

The space is very unique and cool.  The bocce court is a perfect place for a little friendly competition while drinking a couple of bottles of wine with friends.  They have a vast wine list, many from CA and around the world.  They also have a large list of by-the-glass wines and flights, so you can get a taste of multiple wines if that's what you are in the mood for.  There are a few beer selections available as well for those who aren't wino's.

We were doing some afternoon drinking and opted for 2 CA whites that were great, and the wait staff serviced them to us out on the patio - even bringing us our glasses straight to the court, as to not disturb our intense game!

I have also been here for post-work drinks, and the service was excellent - especially for how busy it was.
author: Nic S.

description: What a cool find.  The wine is good, glasses and flights alike.  The pizza was amazing, the sliders were decent - didn't really enjoy the shrimp slider, a little overcooked.
author: Janelle C.

description:
Such a cute intimate place for a date or to hang out with a small group of friends to grab a glass of wine and catch up. Situated in an alley of two main streets, I can't imagine how many times I've passed by and not have known this place existed! Shame on me.

Service was very attentive and polite. Our wines and food came out relatively fast for a busy Friday night. I was a little surprised we were able to find seats at about 8:30PM, but score for us! 

The main reason I wanted to check this place out was for their outdoor bocce ball! Alas, the court was occupied and mix in a little wine and fun times, games can go on forever. Will have to be back to check it out again.
author: Ling H.

description:
I haven't been here in awhile, the last couple of times a friend and I met there after work only to find they were closed for a private party.   If you're planning to go, make sure they are not closed beforehand, because there are not a lot of second choices in the area to choose from.   

When I have gone, it's been VERY good.   I would get the French Whites, and my friend and I would get a cheese plate to share.   So yummy.  Also, a great atmosphere.  It's more intimate than anything, would be the perfect place to start a third date, but good to go with friends too.  It's dark and cozy,a big fireplace, tealights on the tables, lots of big sink-in seating of over-sized chairs and coffee tables or little bistro tables.   

It's really good, price is right.  Just call ahead to make sure it's not closed for a private party.  (Note to self:  a good place to have a private party.)
author: Lori B.

description:
Definitely not easy to find. But the hunt is part of the thrill. Adam made sure that we look for this place, find it and leave satisfied since it's one of my bookmarked places. How sweet is he?:)

We dropped by on Friday night and it is definitely a cool date place perfect for whispering sweet nothings:) Cozy is the word.

Great selection of wine with awesome staff. I noticed that our server was very passionate about their wines and it shows. I love it when the staff love they do and where they work. 

We had a spread of cheese to match with our wines. We had two wine flights from Italy and Spain that night and some wonderful but not too sweet Rieslings of which I am into right now.

The red wines are not that memorable but reasonably priced. The Rieslings from Germany was my favorite!
author: Janet D.

description:
Adorable little wine bar hidden in the financial district. I came here for a friends birthday and it was pretty fun. I'm not a big wine expert, so the servers were super helpful in helping me pick out a sweet, mild white wine that I could enjoy because if not, there wasn't much else I could enjoy there!

The ambiance, is beyond adorable. You feel like you are in the comforts of your own home or a cottage out in the countryside with your friends. They have a lot of comfortable couches for people to lounge in, a room with a round table for larger groups, and an outside area when it's not too cold. 

This is definitely one of those classssssy places. The crowd is a bit older than the rowdier bars.  I'd say average age range is like 30-35+. This is a more intimate setting if you're looking for that. I don't think it's really a place to MEET people, rather a good place to spend time with people you know. Also, it wasn't too packed which was nice. 

I'd love the chance to come here again! One big thing is that they close EARLY! Definitely plan on ending your night early or having a backup plan.
author: Christine B.

description: I really like the cozy feeling this wine bar provides. The wine is good and the setting is very intimate.  The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. My boyfriend and I sat by the fireplace and enjoyed a couple of flights. No one bothered us, it wasn't loud, & the price was very reasonable.  Had a great time.
author: Kendra H.

description:
This place must have had an interior decorator, because its just too fabulous.

looks like your in a fairy tale cottage plus the sophistication to invite winos!
i adore this place. very cool and intimate and yet inviting enough to feel social. 

the menu is limited for food, but its a wine bar, they all serve the same amount of things. 

i highly recommend this place!
author: Brittini S.

description:
A great cheese plate. Pair that with their great selection of wines and you're solid. 

The atmosphere is great as well, very cozy. warm and inviting. It's a perfect place for a date or group.
author: Sabrina J.

description: I don't want people to ever find out about this place so I'm hesitating to write a review :) Wonderful little wine bar - good eats, wonderful ambiance, bocce ball!
author: Food E.

description:
This place is SO freakin' cute, and indeed, hidden.

Came here for a vendor meeting so I didn't have to pay. It IS pricey but everything is up to par and totally worth what you pay.
Cute date spot :) Kinda dark, energetic, open. Servers were really attentive and didn't rush as at all since we were there for a while.

Was surprised that the servers were THAT friendly because it SEEMS like an "uppity" place but the people here are not snobby or anything at all.

LOVE! Will come with the BF next time to enjoy.

PS, go check out the Bocce court!
author: Emily C.

description:
Grab a book, take a seat, and order a glass of wine. I'd do that here at night.

The Hidden Vine is a relaxing wine bar. It's quiet where you can study, read, or just to have some alone time. Great spot to socialize as well.

Think of this place like a local coffee shop, but serving wine instead of coffee.
author: Nancy N.

description:
Definitely fu fu. If you know what I mean. 
Had to leave due to the lack of diversity that night. Hmmm I wonder why that is?
author: Manu M.

description:
HORRIBLE for big groups, I had many unfortunate experiences groups of people.
FANTASTIC for a couple friends. 

The wine is good, not amazing, the ambiance is very quaint. The servers, with the exception of management, are well versed in their selection and very helpful. The food is really good, I have tried almost everything and don't have a negative thing to say. While a little pricey, it's expected in the area.
author: Dee H.

description:
Stumbled in on a Thursday evening.
Nice ambiance. 4.5 stars.
We ordered a couple bottles of wine. Not bad. 4 stars.
Food was crap and expensive. 3 stars. 
The bocce ball court freed up around 10pm so that was fun for about 10 mins. 
Overall experience is more like 3.5 stars but I went down instead of up because I don't plan to come back here anytime soon. If you're looking to just enjoy some wine, it may be worth visiting. However, if you also need food, I'd say go somewhere else.
author: Q C.

description:
Came here around 4pm and the place was practically empty. Decor is very nice -- lots of wood, comfortable places to sit, high ceilings, pretty dimly lit. Service at this time was prompt and the waitress was very professional. However, attention dwindled once it was 5:00 and the place became packed. We probably would've ordered another glass if someone came around, but that didn't happen for another hour, at which point we needed the check.

Very nice selection of wines. I recommend going for one of the flights (three 2-oz pours), but they also offer comparisons (two 3-oz pours). I'd be more inclined to give 4 rather than 3 stars, but was disappointed that there weren't any happy hour prices -- something that might attract more than two patrons in around happy hour!

Overall, the food is very good. However, the olives we got to begin were well flavored, but really hot!! Not spicy hot, just burn-your-tongue hot, which was a bit strange. We really enjoyed the flatbread with pancetta and a balsamic reduction, and they accommodated my friend's request to keep the cheese off of her side of the dish.
author: Justine M.

description:
Love that we each got 50% off a glass of wine just by checking into Yelp.

Place was pretty busy but the ambiance was nice. Would be good for a group outing or a date. Waiter was great considering the amount of people he had to help. Variety of wines to choose from. 

Would try the food next time.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
The first time I came here with a friend, we arrived without a prior reservation and therefore couldn't be accommodated. However, last week I came here again with another friend and this time the reservation really helped.

I am pretty impressed with the cozy ambiance of the place and the wonderful selection of drinks. The bocce court (outdoor) is a must visit here.

I recommend it for get-together and weekend parties but please check the availability before you come in...
author: Deborah G.

description:
This is a good place to go to impress a date that likes wine.  Why?
1. The place is hidden, so you'll look like you know cool places.  Oh, no needs to disclose that you are a Yelp addict.  
2. The place is dark and romantic.  Not laud, so it is a perfect bar to hold intimate conversations.
3.  Good wine and nice service.

TIP:  For extra points, enter from Post Street through Hotel Fitzgerald (http://www.yelp.com/biz/U-qMmkkcD5eNDBSvyGjmOw).  Walk past the lobby and you'll find the door to Hidden Vine (see my pics).  

Hidden Vine is a true wine bar, not a restaurant AND wine bar like Bacar, Nector, etc., so don't come here expecting to eat a full meal.  I really enjoyed doing their tasting flight, where they tagged each glass with the name of the wine, so you know what you are drinking.  

DECOR:  Classic rustic look.  Don't come here looking for a trendy place.  If you want that, go to places like Amelie (http://www.yelp.com/biz/OCk8JFBaOw_p2EY6mi5iLQ) or District (http://www.yelp.com/biz/NZI303NL5iVqOCxZKCfCYQ).  Think living room of an old club house.  No high-end furniture.  Things are a lot more rustic here.     

PRICE:
A typical visit:
$12 Choice of two cheese
$6 Dry-cured Spanish Style Chroizo
$10 Tasting flight (Featured Region of the month)
$14 Taste of California reds
$10 Glass of wine
$12 Glass of wine
$16 Tip and taxes
---------------------------------------------
$80 for two people 

PARKING:  Hard, but not too bad.  I usually find street parking within 2 blocks.  Better luck when you head south or west near the heart of Tenderloin.       

CONCLUSION:  A nice wine bar and I could see why some people love this place.  For me, it's not going to be my favorite wine bar.  I prefer the places with a full kitchen, like CAV (http://www.yelp.com/biz/uyIS_28AlRzzxyvHMvaMsQ), so that I could better pair the wine with more interesting food.  I also didn't run into a wine I liked at Hidden Vine, which I'm sure could change on my next visit.
author: トモ T.

description:
The Hidden Vine is my favorite wine bar (so far!).  It has a great menu, healthy pours on flights and wonderful service.

The space is intimate and has a mix of couches, high tavern tables and seats at the bar.

So, it's not so hidden anymore with over 500 Yelp reviews.  Do get there early to grab a spot, especially if you are growing with a group.
author: Jen Y.

description: This is truly a hidden gem and worth the walk or taxi ride. A very cozy atmosphere. What a great selection of small plates and good variety of wine tasting flights. Many thanks to Casey for really taking care of us that evening. We will certainly be back.
author: John H.

description: Good selections of wines, appetizers & menu items. Been here a few times now and I would go back for sure.  Good with friends or on a date - saying that because it is a bit dark in there, intimate setting.
author: Beth P.

description:
I have been debating whether I should share my favorite spots here, but sharing is caring...

HIdden Vine is the wine bar that I don't even want to tell people as you can tell.
They have a fabulous ambience with the wonderful decor. 
It is hideaway and intimate, usually it is not packed crazy.
You feel like you are in the cool, chic and cozy living room with comfortable sofas and chairs. 
They also have a small patio outside so that you can take advantage of the warm day in SF.  Their private dining space suitable for 10-15 people looks very cool as well.  Their service is pretty friendly and helpful.

I love coming here before dinner for my glass of wine accompanied with their cheese plate.
Great place for a date or for a small group girls night to enjoy the intimate feel.
Highly recommended for cool wine lovers.
author: Tomomi K.

description:
I came here on a Saturday night with friends and we had a great time!  The staff was very knowledgable and helpful in choosing wines, and they have a SUUUPER extensive wine list.

Even though they only give you a wine by the glass list, they have a full list and EVERY wine can be served by the bottle.  

The place wasn't so packed or loud, so it wasn't hard to have a conversation.  And they have some pretty comfy seats and couches to sit on.

We tried the Boomtown 2011 Cabernet and one of the Pinot Noirs on their wine by the glass menu and we were happy with both.  They also had some SCRUMPTIOUS looking food on their menu, featuring an array of cheeses, but I'll have to come back another time to try the food!

They also had wine flight choices on the back of the menu if you're looking for some variety and feeling adventurous.
author: Kelsey H.

description:
Damn, this place be sexy. Just do yourself a favor and go. 

And good luck finding it. It took me an hour. It truly is The "Hidden" Vine.
author: Jen O.

description: hidden financial district...tuesday evening sip...dim lighting & plush seating...sofa and chairs...coffee table setting...romantic...2007 gridley cabernet franc at $sixteen glass...familiar napa flavors..easily drinkable with all bites...little steep at $sixteen glass for $thirty-five market price bottle...order of pickled vegetables $five and waking up tastes with cold tang...good pickling...scrumptious marcona almonds peeled, salted and toasty....never get enough for $four cheap...cheese plate $six with more marcona almonds, sweet preserved fruit, honey and bread delicious...before dinner drinks and snacks $one-hundred-sixty-five for five people...luxury pre-dinner drinking...
author: Hen A.

description:
Jen O. was right when she said, Damn, this place be sexy! 

A great wine bar tucked away in the Financial District, it really is hidden. I came here with my fiancé on a random date night and we were welcomed by a cozy, intimate sort of ambience. We both said we kind of felt like we were at a house party, with the random couches, and fake fireplace. It's not so much a place to go out with a large group and "party", but it's great for dates, or if you just want to hang out and catch up with a couple of friends. 

The woman who helped us at the bar was great! She gave some good recommendations, and was pretty knowledgeable about the various wines on the menu. The pours are pretty generous, which is also nice. I had a nice Rioja, and my fiance had a drier red that was excellent -- but I don't remember the name.

If you're looking to have a low-key kind of night, The Hidden Vine is perfect. We had a great time, and definitely plan on checking it out again!
author: Mishri B.

description:
This is an awesome little wine bar to take a date on. 
The lights are dimmed nice and low, the atmosphere is relaxed, and the crowed is great. Unlike other wine bars where you need to behave, this one is very relaxed and knows its serving ALCOHOL NOT TEA!!

It took me about 10m walking up and down the hotel to find this place, so the name Hidden Vine is not just to sound exotic lol. 

They have a pretty good selection of foreign wines that I tried and could not remember the names of for my life. The service was great, and the wines were delicious ( at least the ones i tried)
Its a really small place, so its not intended to for a large party. Max 4 people in your party. 
The feeling of the place is very...old feeling. I feel like I should be older if i want to hang out there. Nevertheless, i have a lot of fun/success taking dates there. It a must try out place.
author: Corey W.

description: Really a cool spot. We came on a Saturday earlier in the evening and it was not at all crowded and very nice. We were seated right away and our server was hurrying around getting wine, as they do flights it did take a little bit to get our orders with all the extra pouring. But that is understandable and I'm sure on a busier night they would need more than 1 server. I had a glass of the pinot noir from CA and really enjoyed it. We were first seated in a couple of the comfy chairs inside, but as the cool outdoor bocce ball alley opened up, we moved there and played a game. I could see this place being a really cool date night or just a nice place to catch up with friends or even a big group with the large table they have at the entrance. I'm sure it's much more crowded in the evening with the work crowd but definitely a place to check out if you're in the area.
author: Andrew K.

description: The place is quite romantic. It's a nice atmosphere and the employees are friendly. They even have Bocce court in an outdoor space. I gave it 4 stars because it really is hidden. But overall definitely would come again. :)
author: Jane O.

description: Love this wine bar. The perfect atmosphere. Great flights. Definitely a hidden gem in FiDi!
author: Ada K.

description: Great little place! Intimate, staff is friendly, and great wine..... It just feels right!
author: P M.

description: Fun place in the alley behind Club Quarters. Our server was friendly and talkative and the wine selection is good. The appetizers were good and we'll definitely be back. Good for couples, or groups of single girls apparently. Near 10 am on a weeknight there was none of that overcrowding some other Yelpers complain about. A wecoming and relaxing place to relax over wine. I recommend!
author: Thalia F.

description: I love Hidden Vine as an early date spot.  It's generally not too crowded, and is quiet enough to have a conversation, but there's enough buzz to keep the energy up.  Wine list is of course great, and their food options are tasty as well.  Comfy chairs abound, and the servers have always been friendly and attentive.  They have a single semi-outdoor bocce ball court inside as well.  All-around great place for a chill evening over drinks, either with a date or a group of friends.
author: Brian T.

description: It was cozy and quiet the night before Thanksgiving.  We were the only larger group there, so service was good, and I liked the comfortable seating.  Seemed like a good place to chat and catch up.
author: Seong P.

description: This is a great wine bar in the heart of the FIDI.  It's pretty big so it can accommodate large parties but also perfect if you have a smaller group (like say, two people) and you want to be able to hear each other.  The staff is very friendly and knwoledgeable which is always a plus in my book.  They have a front room that always seems to be booked for parties so it's an option if you need a spot for a company gathering or a semi private event.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Really cute hidden wine bar with delicious flat breads and sliders.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Update on new location: This place is still in an alley, but in an amazing space! High ceilings, rustic decor and amazing wine flights. A great place for after work happy hours!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
The Hidden Vine's name is apropos.  It is definately hidden in a small alleyway called Cosmo Pl.  

Careful entering here.  At night the entrance is extremely dark and once you step in, the platform is narrow and the stairs are steep.  If you've been tipping the glass already, be careful not to hurt youself.  You've been warned.  For those less adventerous, you can enter via Post Street through the Fitzgerald Hotel.  But you'll just experience the vine, not the hidden.

Off Cosmo Pl., you descend into a very cozy living room.  Dark and mysterious.  As if you've intruded Oscar Wilde's flat.  Seat yourself and prepare for a treat.  Wines are impressive and intriguing.

After our initial Portuguese and Spanish flirtation, we ordered a flight of beautiful Italian reds.  Cutely hand labeled to pick your poison.  Nice balance and progression.  I loved them all (go figure).  Cheese plate ample and took the edge off before dinner an hour later.  Place was emptying out and we vowed to return later that night, however another wine bar got our last call.

Cannot wait to return to this secret and seculded slice of seduction off Cosmo Place.  Not to be missed if you're in the area.
author: Kalani C.

description:
I organize my company's holiday lunch every year and this year we decided to do something more interactive rather than just sit around a table to chat.  I looked long and hard at the different options around the city and figured giving bocce a try.  

I worked with Danielle, their group reservationist and she was extremely helpful and answered all my questions very promptly.  

The space is extremely cozy, with large sink in sofas, a fireplace, and plenty of chairs to feel right at home.  You almost feel like you've hanging out at a friend's huge living room to have a glass of wine with good company.  

The bocce ball court is located in a small atrium in the building.  It was rainy that afternoon but there were several breaks in the rain where we were able to enjoy playing our street version of bocce ball.  

The staff was great, the food was great although I wish I had ordered more to go around.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Glad I stumbled upon this place (: 

Cool ambience, it can definitely be romantic but at the same time if you go with friends it won't feel awkward. The servers seemed to know the wine pretty well, and they also give pretty good pours. With the comfortable chairs, relaxing/hip atmosphere, and good wine, I could definitely spend hours in here.
author: Alison B.

description:
Hidden is the word for it.  You would have no idea this place is there. 

Met up with a group of ladies I didn't know through my sorority's alumni association.  I think this was just the wrong type of venue for something like that.  This is a good place to share a glass of wine with a significant other, not chat with people you don't know.

Very dark, difficult to hear, and it is not obvious how you're supposed to order.  Best thing about this place seemed to be the bocce ball court.  Worst thing: I got the cheapest glass of wine for I think 8$.  The prices in the city kill me.

Although it is a nice place and hidden away, it's just not for me.  Most glasses averaged 10-15$.  Yikes, I don't like wine that much.  With those prices, might as well buy a 60$ bottle and share at home.
author: Sarah B.

description: Love the location and the ambiance.  I came here early to grab a table.  Based upon the reviews I read this was a smart move.  I got there around 5:30 and grabbed the last table available.  The by the glass list has a nice diversification and the light bites were very good as well.  The only ding is for the service.  While not bad it seemed that most of the staff was staying close to the bar and not servicing the tables as much.
author: Ben F.

description:
Came here for a date. To be honest the place almost threw me for a loop finding it. It's way in the cuts off of battery st. You'll know it when you see it though.
Bocce ball. Sexy ambiance. Quiet and comfy couches. They had an excellent selection of (somewhat expensive) wines to choose from. Attentive and helpful waiter who always seemed to be around when we needed him. Overall excellent experience.

It's an amazing place to bring a date and I almost didn't write this review as I want to keep this place as my little secret, but oh well. Got to give this place its proper due.
author: Marcus T.

description:
The Hidden Vine could be a great wine bar. It really could. The ambiance is fantastic, with a fireplace and beautiful lighting, and it's one of those rare bars where you can actually hear what the members in your party are saying. But when the service is so incredibly poor, it overshadows everything else. 

I get having a bad day as a server, but the woman who attended to our group last night was straight-up rude. Before I even arrived, my friend who arrived first wanted to let the server know that there would be more people coming. All she had a chance to say was, "I have some friends-" before the server cut her off, snapping, "We don't do that here. They'll just have to watch." What?

Once we arrived, it took a good 15 minutes to order our wine. It took three more attempts to get some water for the table and two pleas for the check before it came. We had also ordered a bottle of sparkling wine for the table, and when the server came to finish pouring the remainder, she poured the entire rest of the bottle into my glass and a dribble into one other glass, ignoring the other three women whose glasses were also dry.

Was it the worst night of my life? Of course not. But with so many other beautiful wine bars to choose from, I'm pretty sure I won't be returning.
author: Sarah L.

description: Went here for drinks after dinner in the area. The wine selection is superb and the flights were a really good way to try their diverse menu of wines. I especially liked that they carried wines from small limited release vineyards. The truffles were a perfect pairing to their luscious red wine menu. We will definitely be stopping by here again.
author: Alex G.

description: Wish this was a secret spot, but based on all the reviews, I guess it isn't. Have been many times, always get a table, and there really isn't a bad one. Always have great wine selections and really good apps to accompany. Plus, there is the bocce ball court. Great place to start or meet friends before dinner. Solid date spot as well.
author: Joshua G.

description:
A dark and cozy little wine bar perfect for a third date, a 30th date, or just to laugh and catch up with friends.  Its warmer and softer than Hotel Biron somehow, which is the most immediate comparrison anyone will make.  The seating consists of comfy leather clubs, couches and tables of various heights.  I'm pretty sure there was a solo server and she did an amazing job of keeping up with the patrons last night.  Their wine selection is fantastic, with a very good by-the-glass to by-the-bottle ratio.  The wine menu is divided by description which helps if you're not a seasoned wine taster.  Or even if you are and you just need some help!  They also have pre-selected pairs of half-glasses to compare for $10 and a slection of flights. 

They have bread, cheese, chutney, sausage and chocolate to accompany your wine, but this isn't going to amount to a full meal by any means.  They have a couple of beers on the menu as well as perrier and diet sodas.
author: Molly B.

description:
Champagne flights are hard to come by in my neck of the woods, so I was thrilled to see one offered at The Hidden Vine. And the pours were also generous... a good way to start off your evening, for sure!

The overall experience here was just OK. I came with a group of 6 ladies on a time crunch and this is not a "quick in and out" kind of place (ha! I know, "that's what she said"). Andrea R was right when she said it would be good for a date - as it's better suited for two, maybe three or four people in a group, max. 

Our server was extremely knowledgeable about the wines he served and was slightly irked when we were not as passionate/interested about what we were saying as he was. But again, I don't think he intended to come off that way. The guy just gets serious about his vino. Noted! 

Since I usually come to San Francisco for work (usually in groups of 5 or more people), I doubt I'll be back here soon. BUT if I were to come to San Fran on vacation with the BF or a good friend, this would most definitely be a nice spot to stop in and enjoy some tasty wine in an intimate setting.
author: Abby S.

description:
Tucked away from the non-stop bustle of Union Square and the neighboring Tendernob lies this quaint wine bar that feels like someones old, rustic living room. It's warm, cozy and casual. It's small, and by small I mean you might score a stool and a counter or a large comfy chair and a small "stand" to prop your vino on, but I just love this little spot. Everyone in here seems to be having a great time catching up with friends or having a deep conversation over a flight or cheese pairing. They offer flight trios and duos, both with heavy pours, and there are a few pairing plates you can order too. The selection of wines by the glass is pretty extensive; there's something almost for everyone.

One of my favorite stops for after work or before a lounge/club crawl/outing.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
Hmmm...not a very memorable place cause I didn't realize I had been here before until reading my review from '06 a few minutes ago.  It's very appropriately named because it's quite hard to find. My party of 8 had left ourselves over an hr for drinks before dinner, but by the time we found it we were forced to drink and run in less than 30 minutes.

Our waiter didn't seem too thrilled to seat and serve my party in his near empty bar. We ignored his negative 'tude (no raining on this happy hour) and ordered lots of wine flights for the table. And our small table sure was full with glasses thanks to all those flights! I actually stuck with tea instead since i was trying to take it easy on the alcohol..one of my many New Years Resolutions I've since broken.

Perhaps next time I'll remember this place so I'll know where to find it...and maybe I'll get one of those helpful owners from '06 next time as well.
author: Andrea R.

description: I'm giving this place a bad review for two reasons.  One is that it doesn't deserve an average 4.5 star rating and the other is that their Chardonnay wines (just 2 choices) were terrible.  Message to management:  if you're going to charge $16 for one glass of wine, it better be damn good.  Sorry, not even close.  There are plenty of great wines out there.  Go find them. That's your job. The service and ambiance are both great.
author: Greg W.

description: Great date spot! Delicious flatbreads, good wine and a fun outdoor bocce ball court that you can reserve!
author: Bonnie B.

description: We had a company happy hour over there a couple of times.  We've used the private room and the bocce ball place, both of which are nice with special deco.  The food is ok, typical for a wine bar.
author: Xiaoyan S.

description: My husband and I stopped in for a drink after eating at Kokkari. It was pretty dark and quiet. So if your looking for a hot spot this I not the place. But if your looking for a quiet place to have a drink and grab a bite to eat it is super cute. Great staff.
author: Kendra H.

description:
I have never wanted to give negative stars, but if I could here, then I would.

To quote my coworker after we were rudely greeted by a second employee in a brusque manner, "I have never known a place that did not want business." Basically, we showed up. There was one group of about ten people in one corner and we were three expecting four more. After we told the hostess that we did not have a reservation, she begrudgingly and condescendingly told us that we should make a reservation next time because "(they) get very busy on weeknights." In case it wasn't clear, that is not how one speaks if you want your paying customers to feel welcome and to establish repeat business. 

Of course, several plates of food and 6+ bottles of wine later, the female servers were much nicer to us. And the offerings are not what one would consider "cheap". It is worth mentioning that there was one tall male server who was gracious and attentive to our concerns, especially as we had a couple food allergies in the group. He was definitely the exception and not the norm there. 

I won't be recommending The Hidden Vine for corporate nor personal events any time soon.
author: Cat T.

description: This place is...hidden! I came upon hidden vine in my research for San Francisco's best cheese plate.  Was it? A cheese plate, yes.  The best? No.  But a strong contender.  It is the only cheese plate I've had so far that includes a honey comb.  The place itself is sweet.  If it lived next door to me I'd probably be in on a weekly basis.  But I don't know how often I'll drive to merchant, struggle with parking, just for this bar.  Especially given its size.  If you are just a little late you won't get a seat...and the two amazing seats in front of the fireplace, forget it.  If I do ever get those seats, I am going to stay ALL night long.  The wine selection is decent, the ambiance romantic, discreet...and the bocce court, cool if it happens to be empty.  Which it hasn't been.  So, if my friends want to meet there...I'm in.  Would I suggest it, nope, probably not.
author: Kierstan G.

description: Tucked away little oasis that had delicious and affordable wine flights. Dark and intimate interior but has a small outdoor space with bocce.
author: K Z.

description:
Excellent wine and Bocce!  

Loved the decor, and seems to draw a nice group of people.  

I cannot wait to come back and try some more of their food.  Flatbread we had was excellent.
author: Margaux B.

description:
The wine flights are the way to go. They give you practically three full glasses of wine!

The cheese plate is delicious as well -- we asked for the waitress' recommendation and she didn't lead us astray. 

Only complaint is the price.. this place is expensy!!!
author: Lauren F.

description:
Have you seen that video where that tubby guy was dancing in the street like an idiot and got hit by an ice cream truck?  Oh, the irony.  

That is how I feel today.  Except my ice cream truck was actually 5 bottles of Carmenere.  Hidden Vine hosted us for a birthday party last night and we had a great time.  Great selection of wines - I stuck with my first choice for the duration of the evening since after the first bottle I was cross-eyed and the print on the menu is rather small anyways.  Pretty good food, too.  We also ordered the cheese and meats plate so wild boar and duck carpaccio was a great touch.  

They also have an outdoor Bocce court which is a great touch - if you haven't played Bocce before, check it out.  Great fun. 

Service was fantastic, too...  We were a large group, back and forth between the Bocce court and our tables and we never ran out of wine.  Servers were quite patient with us, too, which I appreciate.  By the end of the night we were spraying f bombs and acting like fools, I'm sure, so I'm certain they hated us.  Here's the good news, Hidden Vine:  I'll definitely come back!
author: Sean O.

description: We've been here quite a few times because it's an easy solution when we find ourselves in the city without any plans. They have a great selection of wines, and the best part is bocce ball! The service is friendly and welcoming even though I'm not as knowledgeable about wines as I should be (having taken a course in winemaking and having learned a lot about wines). Really nice place to hang out.
author: Rita L.

description: beautiful place with good wine and cheese selection.The cute boccee ball place in the backyard is a lot of fun but needs to be reserved in advance. The place reminds of a cozy medieval/urban palace...great experience!
author: Marina Z.

description: What a cute cozy place in the financial district. The Hidden Vine should definitely be the starting point before a night out in the city. when you walk in, there is a semi private area for about 15 ppl and as you walk further in, there are couple of tables and lounge chairs and a wine bar towards the back. On the left side of the room, their is a door that leads you to the bocce ball area. A chalkboard is set up to write your name on the open times. Groups have an hour to play which is plenty of time.
author: Jocelyn T.

description:
BEST marinated olives and great wine selection... seriously can't stop thinking about those olives. They're warm olives drizzled with some kind of citrus garlic olive oil. So good, I need them in my life again very soon.

Great little hidden gem if you love wine... which I do.  Great ambiance -- there are couches and small tables spaced out so that you're not too close to other guests.  The decor has a rustic feel.  Bring a date and check it out.
author: Christina W.

description: Great little place off an alley in the financial district. A girlfriend and I came here for her first wine bar outing. The pours are nice and they have small but satisfying selection. I liked that they not only do a flight but a "comparison" tasting. Get here early because it gets busy with the after work crowd and its tough to find a seat!
author: Katelin N.

description:
Bocce ball year round and vino?  Yes, please!  

The ambiance at this Embarcadero Center-1 adjacent spot is gorgeous (muy romantico, really) and despite a lovely evening of constant SF mist, it was perfect weather on the bocce court.  Thank goodness it's so close to the 1, I have a feeling I will have many evenings stumbling from one to the other.  My new favorite spot for sure, the staff and owner were all quite friendly...in fact, my coworker had to drag me out (I'm no quitter!) .

Everyone's doing marinated olives but the Hidden Vine is doing them right; subtle citrus, thyme & garlic enveloping warm, oil infuse green olives...mmm...delish.  Cheese selection was nice, too, although servings were on the sparse side (then again, I'm spoiled by Amelie).

Things that are certain: I will return, I will order the olives, you will probably kick my ass at bocce ball.
author: MJ P.

description: I've never been to a wine bar before so this was my first time! I totally love the atmosphere, super cozy and homey, but also chic and lively. The wine is great! I had a glass of riesling that was just perfect. Since I was part of the clubbing scene, chilling at a wine bar on a Saturday night was such a refreshing change (and no one is there with the intentions of stealing your cell phone or grinding on you from behind). It feels intimate but also a great place for a group of friends to hang out. There was a birthday party the night we went and the guests were getting pretty rowdy...pushed a table over and heard wine glasses crashing onto the floor. That was the only blemish of our night. Totally would come back again! The Hidden Vine is so adorable!
author: Judy H.

description: Super cute wine bar, hidden obviously. Gets very busy right after work so recommend waiting until after 7:30 PM so you can get a table. Wine flights are delish. Didn't get to try their food but it certainly looks good.
author: Ana J.

description: This place is awesome for a wine bar and apps experience. Really blown away by the wine selections here, and particularly what you can get by the glass. Really liked the vibe and everything about this spot as a way to start the evening.
author: Josh B.

description:
Really cute wine bar tucked away on Merchant Street. I was looking for a nice spot to have a drink and a conversation with my cousin who I hadn't seen in a while. I was going to do a lot of talking and listening so I didn't want it too loud and bar-ish (with TVs).  We were catching up after not seeing each other for 2 years!  First thing I notice is the ambiance is very inviting sort of sucks you in.  We were greeted quickly and asked if we have any questions, I love wine and just wanted a nice recommendation on a Pinot.  The wine list is extensive! I was recommended the Momo Pinot Noir from New Zealand ($12) which turned out to be outstanding! Also, I thought their by the glass prices were fair. Next time I will come try the wine flights or the comparisons. 

We ordered two flat breads ($10 each) which was so yum. My favorite was the speck, roasted black mission figs, arugula and black pepper. Soo good with my Pinot. 

Highly recommend for a date night or a classy after work drinks.
author: Lauren W.

description: Came here for a friend's birthday and only had wine. The wine was good and they had a great range. It's greatly located in the financial district so it's easy to stop by and have a glass after work.
author: A. R.

description: I like it here felt like I was at someone's house. It is a bit pricey if you order bottles. I got a flight of the white crisp wines and it was good. My friends ordered 2 bottles of red. We snacked on yummy pickled vegetables, green olives and almonds. Our waiter was cool and It was date night there I guess. Everywhere I looked couples were making out and one girl literally lost her shoe while face sucking with her man, then they ended up laying on a bench and...lol use your imagination.
author: Karen T.

description:
great place! i was meeting a group of friends, there were 6 of us, so i emailed in advance and made a reservation - they allow reservations for 6+, and hold space for 15 minutes (full group needs to be there). 

we had a couch, table, and collection of chairs around it, which was perfect for the group. tried a few of the wine flights which was great. also got a few apps which were tasty - though the portion sizes were a bit small. just a warning. can also be hard to get a waitress's attention, and the service is a bit slow. then again, its a wine bar where hopefully you're going to go to relax for a little bit, so one should be able to chill a bit and wait :)

a great and cozy stop, we'll be back!
author: Jenn E.

description: This place was nice and bigger than I thought.  Nice wine and decor.  Good place to go on a date.
author: a f.

description: Beautiful ambiance for a gno or date night! Such a hidden gem!
author: Noey A.

description:
I'm not impressed. The service was just OK and a tad slow. The food was delicious, but it'll cost you a pretty penny! Who set the price target on this place at $$??? TRY $$$ and you'll not be surprised when you get your bill. I cannot believe I paid $7 for the smallest wedge of bri and another $7 for the thinnest slices of salami I've ever seen. All in all, the two of us managed to spend $180 and we walked out of there feeling pretty sober and hungry. The pours are some of the smallest I've seen - especially the flights. I'm sorry, but if I'm paying $14 for a flight, it should at least total a glass of wine. How they make it seem like it does total a regular glass? They give you smaller glasses than the glasses they give you if you order a single glass (I compared to my gf who opted for the glass and not the flight). After my mistake of ordering the flight, I quickly changed to just ordering a glass of Zin (for the same price) and felt like I actually received a glass of wine. 

Don't get me wrong, I have NO problem paying for good wine and food, but when you spend $180 and walk out feeling hungry and sober, there's a problem. I guess you're paying for the location and not the food/drinks/service. There are far too many other wine bars in the city that I'd rather check out/revisit than to go back here (even though my office is a block away). I'd rather travel all the way to Polk and revisit http://ameliewinebar.com/. They know how to pour a flight, provide amazing service and food that won't leave you unsatisfied.

I did like your lobster roll and flatbread, however! But I'm sorry, skimping out when there is so much competition out there is just sad in my opinion.

Just to put the price in perspective, you can order an entire 10oz of  Mt Tam brie for $18 and we got like 1oz for $7 http://www.amazon.com/Mt-Tam-10-ounces-Gourmet-Food/dp/B008MCXVTK.
author: Noneya B.

description: Excellent wine list, nice atmosphere, cool place, would give 5 stars but customer service lacking, after initial order no one comes around otherwise the wine is good
author: Joy S.

description: I absolutely love this place. On my birthday trip to San Francisco, we stumbled upon this little gem. What a great spot to get a glass of wine and just unwind!
