description: This place doesn't need anymore reviews, but alas here I am. This place is the shit. Quiet, mixed crowd. Not filled w/ yuppies.  Wine was freaking great, and 20% off all bottles on Friday nights, all night long!! ahh. love it. Got a cheese and salami platter as well, total, the bill was $39.00. I'm coming here like every Friday night from now on....single handsome men, you're invited too.
author: Lauren G.

description: Lovely cozy little place with comfortable chairs.  It's such a hidden place!! and they ahve an awesome cheese platter :)
author: Stephanie C.

description: After seeing so many good reviews here on yelp about this place, I decided to check it out. I LOVED IT! It was exactly what everyone said. Cute, Comfy and Cozy! The servers were very friendly and informative. I ended up getting what they recommended and both the wine and cheese servings were exceptional. I would definitely come here again when I'm back in San Francisco.
author: L L.

description:
i love this place! i went here after my fiasco at ryoko, so this made me happy.  my husband and i each had a white wine tour - and we ordered the cheese plate.  all together it was soooooo scrumptious.  i'm not a huge wine freak, and i really know nothing about it, but the servers / owners were so helpful, and like everyone's already said, so NOT pretentious. 

i'm so glad this place is like a block from my apt.  it's cozy and laid back, i can't say enough good things about it!
author: Alexis W.

description: My OTHER favorite wine bar! This has a nice comfortable atmosphere, and I like the location, its kind of hidden (hence the name!) but easy to get to from the Financial district if you work downtown. The staff/owners are super knowledgeable and I love the wine flights they offer. I also like the paper rings they provide with the flights, you can take them home so you remember the wines you drank and look for them at your local wine shops.
author: Carol B.

description: It says a lot when the owners of the establishment are actually there. Cozy, unpretentious, knowledgeable...yes. This place is all of those things. One tiny little constructive critique: The little seating cove w/ the pillows and little foot stool...a bit too high. Makes conversation awkward if someone is sitting in the standard height seat across the way. Other than that, perfection.
author: Mar M.

description: A good way to unwind after a long day of shopping or whatever brings you to Union Square.  The Hidden Vine is hidden away in a corner where one hopes that it would be never so un-hidden that onecan no longer have a place to un-vine.  It is in the back of a hotel and down the stairs in an alley.  The staff is ever so friendly and unpretentious.  This hidden gem is a great place to start the evening.  There chartcuterie and cheese platters are terrific.  If you need more to food to coat your stomach after the flights, head to Ryoko around the corner for sushi to make sure your tummy won't be rumbling through the night.  On Thursday evenings, there is charcuterie on the house for happy hour.
author: Uimuim B.

description:
Go there. Now. Take a date. Or a friend. Or just go and drink alone if that's your thing. This is my current favorite place in SF. Small, intimate, w/really nice people and knowledgable people working there. Seriously, this place rocks.

At the beginning of each month they pick a region in the world, stock up on wines from that region, and set up a comparison between those and the closest Cali equivalent. Try to guess which wine came from where -- they pair em up so you've got a 50/50 shot.

Perfect place if you're looking for a comfortable, quiet and mature scene.
author: John P.

description: Nice small intimate venue.  Extremely friendly staff. I think the owners (2) wait on you too.  Great selection each month and the price is right.
author: Bren L.

description: If you know nob hill well this place isnt too hard to find tho the entrance is not on post st. Its a cute little find for wine and cheese for an intimate setting or even a larger party. Wine flights are intriguing and the selection is pretty varied. Price range for a wine bar is pretty reasonable. The only complain i have is that waiter came around six times in a matter of minutes waiting for me to make a decision.
author: Farrah S.

description: I love this place!!!  I know  a million people have reviewed this place but it rocks!!  It is the best wine bar in the city (so its true I haven't been to every wine bar in the city), but this one is comfortable and they don't make you feel bad for not knowing wine.    I've been about 3 times and always have a great time.  Go early or late to get a good table.
author: Julie P.

description: Frekin phenomenal...that is if you can find a seat.  Usually its not too much of a wait, since this place is so hidden.  The staff is always friendly, the ambiance is great.  This is one of my favorite places to stop after work with some girlfriends.
author: Vanessa A.

description: I'm really a novice when it comes to wine, but it was great having the guidance from the staff as well as the friendly atmosphere to make me feel more comfortable about it.  The flights were top notch and totally worth it, not only for the affordability of it, but the variance of flavors.
author: Kelly S.

description: Quite a nice place with some very decent wines from which to choose.  The international selection by the glass is a little more intriguing than the domestic selection.  The owners are friendly enough.  And the atmosphere is like the lounge of an upscale bordello from an old western movie set, which is inviting and comfortable.  One tip: get there before the afterwork crowd, if you can.  It fills up quickly.
author: mcmalaprop ..

description: Learned about The HIdden Vine on Yelp when looking for a place to catch up with some German friends who were in town. Turned out they're featuring German wines this month (for Oktoberfest? hmm). Anyway, we kicked back on one of the sofas and ordered California wines and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at this cozy former speakeasy with the friendliest servers I've encountered in SF. The cheese plate was yummy too.
author: Heather M.

description: Chill. Mellow. Whatever you want to call it, but don't tell everyone where it is! This is a fantastic place for a glass of wine to catch up with a friend or for a night cap on a date. The owners are very friendly and they know their stuff. The wine and cheese pairings are quality and not terribly expensive. Highly recommended!
author: Mike P.

description: Wandered in to this little underground wine bar after a dinner in the area... never realized it was here but apparently has been a pub/bar/public space serving alcohol for well over 50 years. Anyhoo....  we had two Port tastings, a Syrah flight, and I think a Zin (it all gets a little fuzzy at this point). We also shared a selection of cheeses and some truffles (perfect with the Port).  The selection of wines was very interesting and eclectic and the staff was very welcoming and knowledgeable. No wine snobs here.
author: Sarah B.

description:
A great wine bar. 
old english style but very cozy, intimate and wellcoming. Wine selections, local and foreign, change every month. great comparison flights. and best of all, the owners David and Angela are extremely helpful and accomodating. great for a small group or an enchanting date. thanks to yelp for un-hidding it!
author: Boryana M.

description: Good place! Loved the dim, cozy, plush setting. The service was nice and they have free cheese/meat/olives/bread on Thursday evenings - major plus. Prices seem to be about right on for the fare and the servings aren't skimpy. The only other wine bar I've been to is Rouge & Blanc (Grant and Bush), but it is pretentious and not so inviting. The Hidden Vine beats it by far.
author: Caitlin H.

description: I felt like I was at a friend's house drinking wine. The couches are living-room comfy and there are private booths if you're on a date. also, the kitchen adds to the "homey" feel.  It's a very cute, warm, and inviting place.  I hear they feature different wines from certain regions, and then change the regions the first of the month. I'll be coming back next month! Plus I met one of the co-owners and he was very knowledgeable and very firiendly.
author: Deanna C.

description:
angela and david are gone! but they have been replaced by jared and co. who took good care of us nonetheless. they don't quite have the cute couple duo chemistry going on, but they still deliver great small production wines in big style! 

keep this goodie alive!
author: Diana L.

description: So...The Hidden Vine is a HOTEL bar. I think only 2 people out of 50+ mention that. It's also very small and the decor is terrible. It's like they turned the breakfast room of a Comfort Inn into a wine bar. It doesn't work. The youngest person in there was 35 and I have a sneaking suspicion that the majority of them were actually staying in the hotel. Good for a date if you're so lazy you can't think of anywhere else in this amazing city. Don't go here if you like feeling comfortable laughing loudly at a joke. Go here if you tend to feel uncomfortable in large groups and love wine plus yuppie company.
author: Ali L.

description: You would never know this little gem was there, tucked away inside the Fitzgerald Hotel, in an area that can only be described as the TenderNob. Inside you find a kind of ambiance not always readily accessible in SF. Small, cozy, quiet, with an old-time feeling a bit like an old Western saloon. The wine choices are vast, the ones I tried were tasty. Apparently they have some sort of a happy hour where they put cheese and bread and meat out for snacking. I had heard they had a food menu with cheese platters and whatnot, but that was not on the regular wine menu and we didn't inquire. All in all it was a lovely place to sit down and have a happy hour drink and conversation with friends. Were I looking to grab a drink in that neighborhood I'd go again.
author: Sivan B.

description: Cute, warm winebar in the same alley as LeColonial. This may be the least "sceney" place I've been to in SF and a perfect place to relax with friends or unwind after shopping at Union Square. The space itself has a library-ish feel to it, the type of place where smoking jackets and cigars might appropriate. The new owners, Dave and Angela, are friendly and knowledgeable, and are often behind the bar.
author: shoba d.

description: "If you were a boy, I would make out with you right now" - so says my roommate, at the Hidden Vine. Yup, it's that intimate and cozy. There are nooks, for nook-dwellers like myself to hide in, or tables out in the little seating area. The hosts are wonderful - so friendly and helpful, and you can't beat the atmosphere, especially on a bustling Thursday evening.
author: Anika K.

description: I didn't think a wine bar like this existed in San Francisco!  Affordable prices, a good selection, and a comfy setting (it's a bit on the claustrophobic side, but consider it cozy).  No need to be a wine connoisseur, if you know what you like and don't like, the Hidden Vine will take care of you.  A friend and I shared a $28 bottle and ordered the sottocenere, an Italian cheese that, combined with their house chutney and berries, was so delicious that we ordered two.  The staff completely contradicted my image of the "uber-snotty wine barista," and they were chill and knowledgeable.  Pre/post-dinner, pre/post-shopping, pre/post-whatever--not very many occasions would be inappropriate to visit to this place.
author: Andrea U.

description: Happily, this is in my 'hood and I make it by here at least once or twice a month.  You have to since they focus on a different region each month.  The proprietors are so friendly and knowledgeable and always make excellent suggestions.  The atmosphere is perfect for just about anything-- chilling out with friends, a date, a business meeting -- you name it.  And don't even get me started on the cheese plate!  I love this place -- hands down the best wine bar in the city.
author: Kate C.

description: This is a great hidden gem! The owners are really friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. It feels like its okay not to know everything about wine here, just what you like. The snacks were very yummy-- they've got a great cheese selection! Definite must go for a wine lover!
author: Jess D.

description: A wonderful place!  The owners may be wine experts but they are not the least bit snobish!  They are friendly and knowledgable and eager to help you have a wonderful time.   Sometimes they have homemade dips and tasty cheeses and things to nibble on while you sip.  The location is "hidden" and it adds to the whole experience.  I felt like we walked through a magic door that took us from the loud and dirty sidewalk into a warm and cozy living room.  You simply have to go here.
author: Valerie D.

description: A very cozy wine bar with an impressive selection of wine.  The staff helped us select a good cabernet.   I was here with a date and  the noise level was comfortable enough for us to have a great conversation. So far, the best wine bar in San Francisco.
author: V B.

description: NOTE: If you are actually going in the main door to this place it's off Cosmos and not Post. Post is the main entrance to the hotel it's attached to. You can get to Hidden Vine that way, but the main entrance is not through the hotel. This truly is a gem of a place. It's located in this tiny that actually has valet parking and 2 upper class restaurants! We luckily found street parking right away 1 block away. I am so happy I got a Living Social deal for this place or I may had never heard about it! You get to the door and go down carpeted stairs to a dimly and romantically Victorian style room. There are all sorts of nooks and crannies to make oneself cozy in and we chose the coziest of them all with deep cozy seating and tons of pillows. The music is kinds indie which is cool, but some of it was pretty obscure and just odd lyrically. The lady who helped us was very nice & attentive. The atmosphere was perfect. The only thing that would had made this place better was if they had some more fixins food wise to go with the wines. We got the cheese plate with all four cheeses and two were really good. The bread was filling, but not great and the olives had pits and didn't have a good flavor that went with the cheese. Because this is such an inviting atmosphere it makes people want to linger and to me having some good lite fair to snack on is essential. Shaves parmigiana, some herb crackers, thicker bread, maybe dark chocolate shavings, berries, a few olive selections, and some other spread beyond the chutney because it was good, but took over the entire flavors of everything else because it's so strong. Will definitely go back, but will need to eat a real dinner beforehand. The place right next door is my dinner destination (Fino).
author: Unicorn U.

description: I really liked the decour and ambiance of this place.   Nice selections of wines and cheeses.  Very cozy place to talk and hang out.
author: Doug C.

description: I can't believe I've never been here before, and that it wasn't very crowded when I went.  Hidden Vine is super cute and PERFECT for intimate conversation with friends.  Great wine, amazingly friendly staff, free cheese, olives and salami during happy hour and very comfortable furniture.  The only thing better is my own living room.  I loved it.
author: Shannon M.

description: good selection of wines, and the service is good.  nothing fancy and low key, a good place to go after work.  one thing....i wish they had a happy hour.  Everywhere else in the city now offers some kind of happy hour prices....hidden vine should follow suit.  just sayin!!
author: Rin c.

description:
Now, I don't want to be one of those people who brags about going to see Audioslave "before they were big" and whatnot, but I was a HUGE fan of the Hidden Vine back when it was still the F. Scott (cause it was the bar of the Fitzgerald hotel... get it!?)
And everytime I wanted to go I was stymied by my friends' susceptibility to the alluring draw of Le Colonial... but I've finally made it and now I LOVE it...Dave and Angela have extended their warmth and energy to their bar :)
author: Anjali K.

description: Great little hideaway wine bar. The owners are very nice and super accomodating. Love to come here with friends. Also, this would be a great place to host an event! Check out Jason's review - he says it best: http://drinkup.jasonebullock.com/2005/03/the_hidden_vine.html
author: Stephanie I.

description: Hidden vine is great.  The perfect blend of off the  beaten path, unpretentious and welcoming.  A rare combination for something so close to Union Sq!
author: Heather C.

description: This a great spot for a pre or post dinner glass of wine.    Really cozy and intimate.  If it were in my hood I'd be tempted to give it 5 stars.  Go after work on thursdays and nibble on the formage and salami.
author: Rudro S.

description: Easily the best wine bar I've been to.  Cozy den of plush seating for parties of 1 to 10.  The service is unbeatable, with kind, unpretentious sommeliers giving their honest hails to the wines on the list.  Also I highly suggest ordering from the cheese menu.  Personally, I always make sure the Cowgirl creamery triple cream cheese is one of my selections.  Mmm like buttah.  And the flavorful chutneys with the cheese and the bread... sip of zin... it's like I never want to leave.
author: Marjorie B.

description: Yep, gotta agree wtih ya'll.... this place is solid. One thing I like is that it doesn't seem to be too crowded. Great, darkish ambience. Not much of a scene. As far as prices go, hell, I think wine bars in SF are expensive, what can I say.
author: Jason M.

description: Great intimate place which truly is "hidden".  The wine flights are fantastic.  The decor of the place has a European, vintage or cabin-like feel to it.  The food selection is limited to cheese, olives... so if you are hungry this is not a place for apps with your wine.  But the wine and service is great.
author: Myra M.

description: Cozy, nice staff and it's yes it's really hidden!  We walked by several times before finding it.  We were a group of 15 and probably offended the couple making out in the room just as much as they disturbed us.
author: T D.

description: I like this place. It's a little cutesy, a little cramped, and a little hard to find, and that's why I like it. On a Saturday night, when other bars are packed to the gills with the Woo People doing their mating rituals (which usually involve screaming "WOO!"), the Hidden Vine is low-key, busy but not overwhelmingly so, quiet enough that you can still have a decent conversation over a glass of wine. And the wine there is well-chosen. I asked the waiter (who looked almost too young to be in there) what he would recommend for someone who loves big, chewy reds, and he pointed me to an Italian wine I'd never heard of which I now wish I'd written down, because it was just at the intersection of cab and zin and made me very very happy. Twinkle, twinkle, four stars!
author: Fawn F.

description:
Big Fan, I have been going here ever since I moved back to San Francisco.  The flights that they offer are always unique and usually dead on.  The owners and staff are very friendly and take the time to explain the wines, where they are from, the varietals and the characteristics.  They always have some fun obscure wine that you won't find anywhere else and the let you buy bottles retail.  The last time I was there they were doing an "Obscure Spanish" flight that featured lesser known regions and some varietals I had never heard of, and I lived in Spain for a year!  I ended up buying two bottles of a very interesting grape (stupid me can't remember the varietal and too lazy to dig it out of my wine rack).

I keep coming back, the atmosphere is great and comfy. It feels like you have been invited to someone's house who has a broad and eclectic wine cellar
author: Brad G.

description: Wine, cheese and date bar. Or cheese, wine and date bar. Or date, wine and cheese bar. I'm not sure of the order ;-)  What you are going to find here is a small, cozy and "warm light" bar that invites you to enjoy the 3 things that I've told you. Price is "trendy" and that is why it does not get my 5 stars. But hey, man, we don't want the Hidden Vine spoiled.
author: Javi V.

description: This place is such a "hidden" treasure, yet there are already 300+ reviews on it. The atmosphere is quiet, romantic, secluded, soft lighting, and totally not what you would expect to find in the city. The wine list could improve some as they were selling Cabernet Sauvignon comparisons from Chile that were both 2007's (way too young to serve and even drink). But the clientele is knowledgeable, kind, respectful, not in your face and they let you just be. I would give them five stars, but they need to improve their wine list a bit. And the sun-dried tomato chutney...tasted like Pace Picante! But I am a fan and I will be back with my sweet bf in a heart beat!
author: Ayrn H.

description:
cute place!  nice ambiance!  i went there on a wednesday night and it was pretty quiet and chill.  big wine selection and they were really great in helping you pick out something you'd like.

also ordered a little plate of cheese, bread and salami!
author: cindy c.

description: This intimate little wine bar hosts an amazing selection.  It's a small spot so if you're not going early it can tend to fill up quick, but all the table are really nice, so it doesn't really matter where you sit.  On cold winter nights it is nice to get a spot by the fireplace though.  Any time I've got some extra cash, and want to treat myself to some good new wine I head to this spot.
author: Nathan C.

description: A quiet intimate bar hidden behind a hotel lobby. They sell unknown little wineries produce. Cheap & great atmosphere.  Great place to taste some wines with friends and talk.
author: Daria G.

description: I really love this place!  It was so secluded and secret.  It felt pretty romantic which could be weird on a first date or something, but i would definately go here regularly.  Great wine, try the flight of reislings.
author: Lyndsey H.

description: Hidden vine is a hidden gem! Great wines, knowledgeable owners, cozy ambiance, and the cheese is fantastic!
author: Annie D.

description: I've been here twice now, for completely opposite situations - once on a weeknight with a large party (10+, huge for such a small venue), and once on a Friday night date. Both times, the service has been just perfect, and the wines were great.
author: Walter L.

description: Great location, best service ever, large glasses and reasonable prices.
author: Philip I.

description: After wandering around the block a few times, I thought that maybe my relationship with The Hidden Vine would be brief and futile, but when I found the entrance tucked away on a little side alley and descended the stairs, I knew I was going somewhere special.  The darkly lit plush lounge said class and sophistication, and the servers were incredibly friendly and helpful as our group grew from a quiet family graduation celebration to a slightly more raucous group with constant requests for bottles of wine, glasses, and chair rearrangements.  I'm no wine connoisseur, but the list seemed pretty extensive and covered a large range, from the ridiculously-too-expensive-for-me to quite-drinkable-and-also-reasonably-priced.  This is a very comfortable, friendly place that tends more toward classy than hip - they're not trying too hard, they just get it right.
author: Rachel B.

description: I came here on a Friday night and I must say it was the perfect place to chill, relax, have a nice bottle of wine and carry on a conversation, devoid of any obnoxiously drunk people. The workers here are super nice and knowledgeable on any questions you have on the wines. Kat helped us out and she made us feel comfortable in asking questions about the wine that normal snoody places would frown upon you for asking. The ambiance and atmosphere here was mellow almost as if you were chillin in your living room at home. There's couches, comfortable lounge chairs, tables with chairs and hightops with barstools so theres basically every option of what type of seat you want to take. I would suggest coming here if you want to hide away from the hustle and bustle of the loud bar scene since it's hidden in a hotel and not really noticeable from the street.  Two Thumbs Up!
author: Krystal G.

description: An great place to unwind from a day of shopping.  The name holds true, it is hidden.
author: erin h.

description: Best most quaint wine bar in town, try a flight of red or white, and enjoy the music and cozy European-style ambiance.
author: PJ T.

description: Perfect spot when you're in the mood for a quiet, lovely conversation over delicious wine. Went after a play, tried a comparison between to Argentinian wines (their featured country of the month) and also had cheese and olives... YUM. We got there around 9:45 and there were a few tables available. By the time we left, around 11, there was a wait. I'll definitely be back.
author: Cary M.

description: Can't wait to return. We tried to down 2 flights prior to dinner. Should have left more time to mingle here but had to leave for dinner. Wish they opened earlier than 5 on Fridays. It was chill, a little Billy Idol in your day never hurt anyone. We were tipsy after our hour here....
author: Chelsea B.

description: I decided to take my girlfriend here on her way home from work since she walks up Sutter st. from downtown and since I live 2 blocks away. It was a nice and cozy suprise with good mellow music and not overly crowded around 6ish on a Tuesday. The seating and lighting are great for intimate conversation over some vino. However, I wasn't too impressed with the wines by glass list and the cheese plate left me wanting a little more cheese for my chuck (if you know what I'm saying). The Hidden Vine would get another star if it had a fire place and another for flexibility on the menu like; more good reds by the glass.  I'm sure I'll go back for the comfortable atmosphere, vino and a discussion on relationship logistics. Dammit, maybe the fireplace is structuraly impossible but I'm trying--k?
author: Michael M.

description: I keep finding my way back here because the guys behind the counter are just that cool!!!  You tell them what wine you're in the mood for and they will provide without making you feel weird that you don't exactly know what you want...in wine.  Now If only they can help with decision making outside of wine.   Also, it helps that this place is cute and cozy, like being in a friend's den.  I ususally come after work (around 5-6) and once around 10p.  I've heard that it gets pretty busy outside these times, but I have yet to see for myself.
author: Aimey T.

description: Wonderful little hideaway. My friend recommended this place to me and boy am I glad she did. The service was wonderful and I especially loved the cheese and chutney plates. I was very pleased to find out that " Mcquades Chutney" is actually made by a local woman from San Francisco. Great service, great wine selections,cozy, intimate, and relaxing. I just loved this place and will definitely will be back.
author: lisa v.

description: Hidden Vine,,,  No duh...  It's hidden alright...  After much labor and toil, we finally found this wonderful wine bar.  I must admit  that they (patrons, owners, whatever), weren't so happy to see us stumble into the fine bar located at the back of a hotel lobby of the Fitzgerald.  Ha ha, I just gave it away!!  Go there.  Have good wine, and don't mind the snobby neighbor trying to read a book next to you, irritated that there are a bunch of us drunks being loud and obnoxious....
author: Kiyomi M.

description: The staff are not your wine snob assholes.  The wine selection is spectacular.  I love the ambiance, secluded, romantic and cozy.  I go there alot with my co-workers and on romantic dates with my beau.
author: Food F.

description: This is my favorite wine bar in SF. The atmosphere is cozy, people are relaxed, and the wine selection is superb. My friends and I will often end our evenings with wine and truffles here. Highly recommended.
author: Catherine L.

description: The lounge was cozy and very cool but the service is the bottom of the barrel. I visited on a Friday night with a small group of friends - the place only had one other table with guests. We sat down and started ordering from the owner, who became seriously agitated when one of the girls in our group asked questions about one of the beers on the menu. He skipped over her enitrely and took someone else's order. He got increasingly angry when a person in the group  tried to make a joke to lighten the situation. The owner then kicked us out. The guy who tried to make the joke apologized but the owner threatened to call the police. We're a group of mellow, professional 40 year olds who wanted a glass of wine. Instead we were kicked out.. Amazing.
author: Anna K.

description: Nice, quiet wine bar, tucked away. Even when it was crowded you could still carry on a conversation without yelling. Great wine selection, and the owners were friendly and knowledgeable. My friend and I didn't know which wine we wanted. We gave them a description of what we liked, and they picked out an awesome wine for us. I would definitely go back for a mellow night out with friends (or for a first date, as I witnessed while I was there).
author: Madhavi K.

description: Just across from one of my favorite restaurants, Le Coloniel, the Hidden Vine truely is hard to find. Friendly, knowlegable staff, decent selection, generous pours, and decent cheese plates makes this one of the better wine bars in SF. I've been back 3 times to try their changing tastings.
author: Jon b.

description:
i love love LOVE this place. super cute. great wine selection - although i never pick my own. the staff is incredible and always know exactly what i want when i come in. i've probably tried more wines than i have colored chuck taylors (and that's a lot) and have been satisfied ever sip of the way. GREAT date spot. GREAT single spot. GREAT gay spot. GREAT straight spot. if only we could bring our dogs...

GO HERE NOW. you won't regret it. and get the truffles. go on, spoil yourself...get the cheese plate too. maybe even some cured meats to top it off. now i'm hungry.
author: diane t.

description: I adore it.  I ran into one of the owners of this place before it even opened about 3 years ago.  I think it was at Lucky 13...anyways, I was there grabbing a guinness with a friend and we met this guy and his partner who said they were opening up a wine bar soon downtown.  We jumped at the opportunity to learn more and got his card...months later, voila.  The Hidden Vine.  And it has totally met all the expectations I had for it through the years:  A cozy, intimate venue with yummy wines and friendly, accomodating service.  I'm going again tonight, in fact.  With that same friend I met them with.  :)  Ahh, comforting.
author: Amber B.

description: Cozy, warm atmosphere with decent wine selection and knowledgeable bartender. I've come here with a book club and some of the members felt that the staff were a bit hostile to a group, but I didn't get that same feeling. It's in the perfect location extremely close to union square but avoids the tourist chattle that happen to wander into less hidden locations. I definitely consider this a date appropriate place as well as perfect location to catch up with close friends. I would not characterize it as a party place--good for a pre- or post- dinner glass.
author: Snora E.

description: Small, quaint and quiet with a nice selection of wine flights.  Not worth a special trip, but worth stopping in for a pour if in the area.
author: jason m.

description: Love it.  Go there.  I recommend the wine.   Always enjoy the "blind taste test"  round.
author: Kathy M.

description: This place is perfect for an after work drink.  Everytime I go into the city I try to make it here.  It very unpretentious and cozy.  The wines are reasonably priced and they have bottle specials on certain days.  They also have a selection of cheeses and chutneys to choose from.
author: Anne N.

description: i love this wine bar...it is so cozy and comfortable..it is not about being pretentious or trendy..its just about enjoying the wine and having fun with whoever you are there with. The staff is really knowledgable about the wine selection and the flight tastings are alot of fun..if you are looking for a wine bar with comfy couches..this is the place to go!!
author: Erin S.

description: I almost don't want people to find out about this place because it is so cozy and great. The wine was amazing and the staff were friendly, helpful, and knew their wine. Not a huge party place, but when you are looking for a cozy, low key, romantic place where you can chill and actually hear what the other person has to say - this is a GREAT place!
author: Stephanie R.

description: This place was such a great find!  Thank you YELP for this one.  Spent last weekend in San Francisco with my fiance and we aren't the type to want a crowded club/bar, so this place was just perfect.  When we got there, there was one guy inside at the far table working on a laptop.  So we could have had our choice of seating, we chose to sit at the bar because we are social people so why not.  Sara the bartender and master sommelier was so awesome!!!  We tasted some amazing wine and learned so much about what we like and why we like it.  We had so much fun just hanging out and talking.  A few other small groups of people came in and we all started talking, which is cool.... it felt like we were at someone's house.  It did get busier around 9 or so, but it was never packed.  Honestly, if you don't like loud bars and you want to learn about wine, this place is perfect.  We were there for much longer than we anticipated but had a great time and will be back for sure!
author: Kelly C.

description: yes, it's hidden, kinda, but it's always full... as well it should be, b/c this place is the cutest lil wine bar around.  excellent selection, good prices for lofty pours, and the featured wines change monthly.  also, the staff is super nice/remembers you from last time, and the cheese plates are simple but sufficientlly sized and quite tasty.  it's the perfect setting for an after dinner, let's-get-cozy bevarage.
author: Ariane R.

description: This place is solid.    A group of us stopped in for a nightcap after dinner before making our way back to the hotel.  My drink of choice is red wine, though I'm no wine connoisseur.  The flights are great and pretty heavy.   Mellow atmosphere - warm, comfortable, and dark.  The noise level is ambient so conversation is easy.  No unst unst here.
author: Yasamin B.

description: This place is cozy and casual. You feel like you're in someone's living room! Defintely a hidden gen-although after 300 reviews on Yelp I guess its not so hidden anymore!
author: monica r.

description: A very hidden vine indeed, this laid back wine lounge feels more like a living room than a bar. Enter in a small alley off of Post, called Cosmos, descend  the steps and you'll find yourself in a cozy underground gem of a plush lounge filled with comfy sofas, chairs, and even foot rests! Antique lamps add a dim glow to the chill scene. On a Tuesday night around 10, this place was relatively empty. Perhaps people don't know about it, but that's fine by me. The bar tender is extremely nice and helpful. The wine selection is extensive, carrying wines from all over the world, even Israel. Unfortunately my good taste was a hindrance, as I initially ordered a sparkling Moscato from Israel. Apparently this was also the most popular wine available, as well as the one wine in the entire bar that was out of stock. So I ended up with a different sweet wine, from Sonoma or somewhere in the Napa Valley. Not overly sweet, not my favorite but definitely pleasant. Therefore, the high reviews are based therefore on the ambiance, and potential wine selection. I'll be back to the Hidden Vine, and am very much looking forward to trying the Moscato!
author: Kate A.

description: adding to the love: took my mamma-in-law and had a wonderful evening--the service is wonderful and friendly, atmosphere is relaxingly grown-up, you can sample 3 wines for $10, and the chocolate truffles are amazing--get them!
author: Mia B.

description: Wow this place is amazing.  You can really feel that this is a cozy owner-driven establishment.  The couple who run this place are so friendly and warm that you wouldn't even guess that they're the ones in charge of it all.  I'm a huge fan of wine that's off the beaten track and just good vs. pretentious 'cult wines' or over-branded vintages.  And these two have got great hunting skills for wine.  If you get a flight, they write tags naming the wine on each glass.  I had to stuff them in my pocket after I was done because I have to find a bottle or a case!  Their taste is priceless.
author: Jason K.

description: I don't do 'cozy' and the phrase 'charming', unless immediately coupled with 'young lass', has a tendency to piss me off mightily.  That said, there's something infinitely appealing about this overtly cozy and charming basement bar, that seems just the sort of place you might take refuge in to escape from the chill embrace of oncoming fog.  Yes, the decor is a touch 'ye olde english' bronte-esque, and yes, it's in a hotel, and yes, it's accessed from an alleyway across from le colonial--ignore these features and focus on the positives, which are many and wonderful indeed.  The proprietors have assembled a focused and wonderful list that includes some familiar themes for you mundane folk shamefully addicted to the obviousness of napa merlot, but includes a number of cool and interesting items for those with a bit more adventurous a soul: flights are imagineative and education (and generously poured) and change frequently.  And speaking of the proprietors, they are incredibly friendly and gracious and deal with the occasional riff-raff that wander in (ah yes, "Sideways" has emboldened even the most feeble-minded of the cocktail crowd to order pinots that they couldn't possibly enjoy) with civility and aplomb.  The husband/wife duo that man the bar are always quick with a helpful suggestion and generous with their samples.  Given the jazz-infuzed, english-country womb-like feel to the place, I'd recommend this as more of a spot to wind-down the evening (i.e. it's probably not a place to hit to get ready for some raving).  In short, it's a wonderful addition to the new slew of winebars in this city--I'll certainly be there more often, and I suggest you do the same.
author: Kosuke I.

description: i dig this place.  the servers here are friendly and have great recommendations.  the ambience is inviting and the dim lighting and comfortable seating make it difficult to leave.  envision your living room by a cozy fire.  i've been twice and will continue to come back.
author: Danny W.

description: We just keep coming back. With friends, with coworkers, with our parents,  all dressed up, in simple threads, or worn out at the corners in tees and jeans to wear when washing the dog.  The place is tucked away and I've never felt a dab of pretentiousness, and there's a nice variation in pricing on the menu to suit the varying fatness of my wallet.  It feels like a neighborhood treat, with perhaps a touch more class.  This is what I'd expect the Pub to be if it amped up the wine, cut down on the beer, and moved to San Francisco.  I'm lucky never to have been on too busy a night--the place is tiny and feels lively--I can't imagine what it's like on a non-week night.  I'm not sure if the Hidden Vine is knock-your-socks-off enough to rate 5 stars, but I can't think of anywhere it goes wrong.  Even the crappy watercolors on the wall bring a smile to the face because the art is so bad and the framing's so decadent.
author: Eartha K.

description: I stumbled upon this place when I was wandering around downtown with a small group of friends. The vibe of the establishment is very mellow. I typically expect wine bars to be pretentious, but this wasn't at all. It was warmly lit and all the seating looked very cozy. It took a little while for us to get some chairs, but when we did, we were perfectly comfy.  The other thing that made this place solid was the fact that they had a meat and cheese plate in there and weren't jerks about the fact that we were all starving and gorging ourselves on their free food.  We ended up ordering a bottle of riesling, and when the server came back he asked us if the temperature of the wine was okay. We all thought it was fine, but he insisted that it was not correct temperature. We kept the bottle anyway, and when we got the bill, he still took off 10 percent and wrote a little note saying "discount for putting up with crappy wine temperature"  We thought it was super cool of him to do that and left him with a nice fat tip.
author: Jade L.

description: I had SUCH a lovely time here.  I walked in and thought, "yes, this is EXACTLY what I am looking for".  It was so cozy and friendly, knowledgeable yet far from pretentious.  Reading other reviews I think it's probably a better idea to go in groups of two or three max.  This is the first place to warrant more than a 20% tip in a looooonnngg time (and I'm a server).  Yay!
author: Autumn L.

description: Definitely a wonderful find.  These guys know their wine and offer up great suggestions to keep the tasting and experience flowing.  The food pairings are enough to keep things interesting.  Their wine offerings are very good and very broad. One of my favorite new haunts.
author: tobin t.

description: Was not expecting much but really enjoyed this tiny little hideaway. Perfect  closer to a day full of shopping. NIce choices of wines and great advice from the owners. They also had live music which added to to the enjoyment. Not a scene, just a cozy place.
author: Rachel B.

description: By far one of my favorite wine bars in the city. It's a great place to bring a date or a small group of people. The staff is friendly and helpful and the wine specials rotate to feature a different country every month. Perfect place to stop off for a glass of bubbly and a nosh before the theater. Highly recommended.
author: Amy O.

description: i randomly came upon this place with a group of friends and was so pleasantly surprised! fyi - get the tasting flight! for under $10, you get 3 FULL glasses of wine! what a deal!
author: Kate Y.

description: A recent find for me, went by a recommendation from a friend who lives near-by. What a find! Other then parking problems, a very enjoyable experience.  Not only they have very knowledgeable bartenders, but the truffles we ordered with our wine and cheese were also incredible.  It's a perfect place to hang out with a small group of friends.  I'm not taking away a star for location, because the location is actually great, parking is a problem all over the city anyway.
author: Laura K.

description: one of the coziest, friendliest, most relaxing atmospheres in the city, even for a wine novice like myself. craig and angela are my vineyard heroes.
author: Chaney K.

description: difficult to find seating but this cavernous little escape from everything has the coolest, super knowledgeable staff and some excellent wines (ask for a handsome syrah, named justin ; )  beautiful little accoutrements to the well-chosen flights in the form of a cheese plate with all the local faves (hello humboldt fog!) and carefully arranged charcuterie (i'm a veggie and the cold cuts looked good).  went with a handsome group of guys (i do recommend this to any woman in her right mind) post dinner and it was the perfect way to commence an evening of all things great.  this vine may be hidden, but it is certainly worth the find.
author: mimi t.

description: A well hidden gem. I love the environement here. The staff knows all about the wine and made some great recommendations. Definitley doing happy hour here again.
author: Linda L.

description: I'm a wine nut as one can tell by my reviews, so I poked in here a couple weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised by the room, cool, kinda Twin Peaksy in a more classy contemporary way. Staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and excited about the wines they were pouring. It's a cool place to have a glass and relax and by no means would I not recommend it to people, especially if they don't drink lots of wine. Because, though service and ambiance receive five stars, the wine list was provincial by San Francisco standards, and was really pouring nothing out of this world amazing or anything really remotely unfamiliar, (though it was odd to see a Navarro wine by the glass, which was a first in the city,) Winery's like Laurel Glen and Serenity are really common, boring wines, so though I sucked down two glasses of wine, the Pinotage was simply OK and the Handley was great, but I knew that going in, and see Handley wines around quite frequently. This place could be brilliant with such a cool space and such good service if they took some more risk like District or found a way to get rare cult wines like The California Wine Merchant, but all in all, a very nice wine bar!!
author: Steve l.

description: excellent wine bar.  many good deals, can get bottles to go. very friendly and helpful staff. cool location. some of the seating can be uncomfortably shaped.
author: christopher a.

description: A small group of us went here for a drink after dinner at Le Colonial.  The space seemed cool but we quickly learned the service is horrible.  They were not busy at all - there were only 4-5 other people there - but the minute the owner came to our table to take our orders he was rude & impatient.  One of the woman who was with us had a couple of questions about the selection which he seemed to find annoying...like we should be prepared to just order w/out asking him anything.  When one of our group made a small joke to lighten the mood, the owner told us to leave or he would call the cops.  Let me be clear - we are not a bunch of drunk college kids.  We are all in our late 30's - early 40's & are doctors, lawyers, in finance or business.  The owner seemed to think he was the "soup nazi" from Seinfeld.  I will certainly never go back & highly recommend you avoid this place if you value good service.
author: Eden G.

description: What a funky little place.  Great wine selection and even some tastey treats.  The service is a bit slow, therefore losing a star.  A place that small with the staff that was working, it should have been a bit better than it was.
author: The R.

description: Went here last week and enjoyed it a lot, certainly a good spot for a clandestine rendezvous. The only downside was the bartender promoted a wine special to us and neglected to inform us of the inflated price by the glass. Most of their wine by the glass falls into the $10-12 range but this turned out to be a whopping $17 for a single glass ! A bit sneaky I thought but then we should have asked also, next time you can be sure we will. Buyer beware I guess...
author: J l.

description: This place used to be my favorite wine bar in the City--unpretentious with fabulous wine served by a husband and wife who were passionate about wine and took great pleasure in sharing their passion with others. Truly was in a class by itself. Sadly, they sold it and it is now owed by someone off sight who has hired managers. It is not the same; the people working there now are just going through the motions. Now its just another wine bar-nothing special to recommend it- but fine for a glass of wine.
author: michele c.

description: The Hidden Vine is cozy, homey and local with a private clubhouse/living room feel and two friendly owners who know a lot about wine. It's a great little hidden-away place to chill. Don't tell anyone!
author: A R.

description: This place is great for a Friday night friends gathering.  They've got great wine.  My friends and I all loves this place and I think we'll consider this as our place for chi chat gathering....
author: Little S.

description: I love this place!  The wines are fantastic, the owners are friendly, and the atmosphere is so relaxing.  Perfect for an quiet chat or catching up with a few friends.  Don't try to come here with a large  group though - it's tiny.
author: Alison D.

description: This place has the worst service I have ever experienced, here or abroad (including Asia), and would perhaps best remain "Hidden."  Although the allure of the cozy lounge is indeed palpable, customers should not expect to be treated as such.  When I made a harmless joke in hopes of establishing rapport with the man taking our order, he became agitated and indicated that we should all leave, then performed an about face and scurried away.  I followed him and explained that I meant no harm, and then volunteered to leave, with the request that my friends be allowed to stay.  Rather fiercely, he responded that that all of us had to leave to pay for my trangression.  I am not kidding.  It struck me that I was dealing with the most omnipotent order taker in the Tenderloin, and I decided to make haste before things got out of hand.   One of our group remained behind to discuss the matter further, at which point he declared that we were on private property; then he began dialing the police.  I am not kidding.....we hung around for a few minutes to see if the police would actually show up, but then lost interest and moved on to spend our money elsewhere.....needless to say, we will not visit this Tenderloin gem again.
author: Eric J.

description: the best. what can i say? everyone else has already said it. this place is simply the best! a cozy wine bar hidden down a back alley in the heart of SF. this is what life is all about! i just love it so much i felt i had to at least give it yet another 5-star rating!
author: O B.

description: cute place. mediocre wine. verrrrry slow service. don't recommend it.
author: glitz g.

description: I debated whether to give this place four or five stars for a few minutes, mainly because I'm a big wine bar fan and I've been to so many great ones that I wanted to be fair (and not get overexcited)! But while I was  debating it I realized that... I just really really love this place! First, the decor is extremely soothing and relaxing -the visual equivalent of a smooth, tasty glass of pinot. Second, it is very versatile. I know that whether I'm here on a date, or with friends, or with my dad (yes, I brought my dad here when he visited from Greece!) I'll be having a great time... and whoever I'm with will be having a great time too! Third, I love the music -especially last night they had a fabulous subdued 80s mix that made me very happy! Fourth, their cheese is yummy! And last but not least... obviously the wine! They have not only tasty, but very interesting selections, for glasses, bottles, flights, and comparisons. It is also a great opportunity to compare California wines with wines from other places -or to just try wines from countries you can't travel to- because it features different countries, switching between various wine-producing regions of the world. The only thing that annoys me a bit is that it doesn't have a set closing time... and I am a bit of a night owl so I never know whether it will be there for me!
author: Victoria K.

description: i can't say enough about this wine bar.  it is so warm and welcoming, not at all pretentious. worth checking out.
author: j m.
